baseitem.name: Thinker's Tools
entries: {@b Ability:} Intelligence
{@b Utilize:} Ponder (DC 20)
{@b Craft:} Book (Fiction)
{@note Made by Gem}

baseitem.name: Teeth Bomb
entries: As an {@action Utilize|XPHB} action, you can light a Bomb and throw it at a point up to 60 feet away, where it explodes. Each creature in a 5-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point makes a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 6d6} Piercing damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.
{@note Made by Marvin}

baseitem.name: Faeorran Wine (Bottle)
entries: {@i This wine is made from Sweet Faeorra, a rare grape-like fruit found in the feywild. The wine is a deep red, very sweet, and very high in alcohol content.}
A creature that drinks an excessive amount of this wine must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it becomes {@condition Poisoned} for 1 minute.

Whenever it ends its turn while {@condition Poisoned} in this way it moves 10 feet in a random movement. Roll {@dice 1d4} for the direction: 1, north; 2, east; 3, south; or 4, west. If it collides with an object or creature within this movement, it falls {@condition Prone}. This movement provokes {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}.
{@note Made by Gem}

baseitem.name: Gummy Apple
entries: Mmmmmm Yummy appl. Eating this is food. Yumm
{@note Made by Gem}

baseitem.name: Anarchic Water
entries: When you take the Attack action, you can replace one of your attacks with throwing a flask of Anarchic Water. Target one creature you can see within 20 feet of yourself. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 plus your Dexterity modifier and Proficiency Bonus) or take {@dice 2d8} damage if it is a Construct. Roll a {@dice d8} for the damage type.
{@note Made by Aris}

baseitem.name: Axe
entries: Working for 10 minutes, you can use an Axe to cut down a tree less than 5 ft in diameter. Working for 1 hour, you can use an Axe to dig a hole that is 5 feet on each side in wood or similar material.
{@note Made by Gem}

baseitem.name: Axiomatic Water
entries: When you take the Attack action, you can replace one of your attacks with throwing a flask of Axiomatic Water. Target one creature you can see within 20 feet of yourself. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 plus your Dexterity modifier and Proficiency Bonus) or take {@dice 2d8} Force damage if it is an Aberration or an Elemental.
{@note Made by Aris}

baseitem.name: Crab Suit
entries: {@i To create a cheaper, more easily produced version of the popular Fish Suit, gnomish inventor Nadul DaRoni created the Crab Suit, a suit of armor made to handle deep water pressure.}

This bulky suit, which fully encases your head and body, takes 10 minutes to don or doff. While worn, it enables you to breathe in an airless environment and renders you immune to the harmful effects of any gas that surrounds you for up to 8 hours.
Once worn for 8 total hours, the suit's property is unusable unless the suit is recharged for 1 hour in an elemental air node (or dedicated Crab Suit Recharger).
The Crab Suit allows the user to withstand depth pressures of up to 750m, with more resistant models able to withstand even greater pressure.
{@note Made by Patrick}

baseitem.name: Darkvision Powder
entries: This plain gray powder clings to surfaces and cannot be seen with normal vision from more than 10 feet away. It glows brightly when viewed with {@sense darkvision}, and thus is useful for creatures that have {@sense darkvision} and wish to write messages that other creatures can’t read. Each vial contains enough powder for a message of up to 25 words. By adding a mixture of spider silk oil, an ink can be created with the same properties as the powder.
{@i This item can be crafted using {@item Alchemist's Supplies|XPHB|Alchemy Tools}.
{@note From S3, 3.5e Drow of the Underdark, ported by Aris}

baseitem.name: Diving Mask
entries: {@i Comprised of an airtight mask, goggles, and an air tank, the Diving Mask was made as a portable solution to air deprivation and light underwater travel.}

The Diving Mask allows the user to connect to an air tank, expanding their breathing capacity and prolonging suffocation. A full air tank connected to a diving mask provides 6 hours' worth of breathable air.
{@note Made by Patrick}

baseitem.name: Messenger Pigeon (Trained)
entries: {@creature Messenger Pigeon|WM4}
{@note Made by Patrick}

baseitem.name: Messenger Pigeon (Untrained)
entries: Can be {@item Messenger Pigeon (Trained)|WM4|trained} as a bastion turn.
{@creature Messenger Pigeon|WM4}
{@note Made by Patrick}

baseitem.name: Paxel
entries: The Paxel is a tool that combines the utility of a shovel, an axe, and a pickaxe. Working for 1 hour, you can use the Paxel to displace a 5ft cube of soil, stone, or wood.
{@note From WM3, Made by Jarod}

baseitem.name: Pickaxe
entries: Working for 1 hour, you can use a Pickaxe to mine a hole that is 5 feet on each side in soft rock, or 8 hours for hard rock. Using a Pickaxe gives you Advantage on Strength checks to remove gems and minerals from stone.
{@note Made by Gem}

baseitem.name: Sheet Music
entries: {@i This piece of parchment teaches the reader how to play a specific written piece of music, so long as the user knows the notation.}

When you attempt to play the song written on this piece of sheet music and you are proficient with the instrument you are playing, any roll of 4 or lower on the D20 roll is treated as a 5 instead. Any given piece of sheet music must depict a specific song, and its benefits only apply to playing the given song.
This item may be copied and printed at a scriptorium.
{@note Made by Patrick}

baseitem.name: Stiletto-heeled Boots
entries: These boots can be wielded as a {@item dagger|XPHB} while on your feet. However, they have a -2 to hit, unless the boot is wielded in a hand, you are airborne, or the attack is made against a {@condition prone} creature.
{@note Made by Aris}

baseitem.name: Swim Clothes
entries: These clothes are treated to be water resistant, quick drying, stretchy, and low absorption, great for swimming in!
{@note Made by Landon}

baseitem.name: Unholy Water
entries: When you take the Attack action, you can replace one of your attacks with throwing a flask of Unholy Water. Target one creature you can see within 20 feet of yourself. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 plus your Dexterity modifier and Proficiency Bonus) or take {@dice 2d8} Necrotic damage if it is a Celestial or a Plant.
{@note Made by Aris}

baseitem.name: Urchin Venom
entries: A creature subjected to Urchin Venom must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or have the {@condition Poisoned} condition for 1 minute.
{@note Made by Aris. Adapted from 3.5e There Is No Honor}

baseitem.name: Vrock Dust
entries: This powder made from the dried spores of a vrock provides a potent, pleasurable high when inhaled. A creature that consumes this drug must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature is {@condition Poisoned} for the next 10 minutes. While {@condition Poisoned} in this way, the creature is Vulnerable to Radiant damage and automatically fails any saving throw inflicted by a Celestial or Fiend.
A creature addicted to Vrock Dust experiences potent cravings for more Vrock Dust, and will often do anything it can to obtain additional doses of the drug.
{@note Credit to FungusAmongUs's Abi-Dalzim’s Abhorrent Adventurers}

items.name: Ability:
entries: Charisma

items.name: Utilize:
entries: Sing a known tune ({@dc 10}), or improvise a song ({@dc 15})

items.name: Ability:
entries: Charisma

items.name: Utilize:
entries: Put on a rehearsed performance ({@dc 10}), or improvise a performance ({@dc 15})

items.name: Ability:
entries: Charisma

items.name: Utilize:
entries: Put on a rehearsed show ({@dc 10}), or improvise a show ({@dc 15})

baseitem.name: Juggling Club
entries: {@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Carcinization
entries: {@i The Crab Cycle: there is only one step and it is crab.}

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can cast {@spell True Polymorph|XPHB} on yourself into a {@creature Crab|XMM}. When you do so, the duration of the spell is Until Dispelled. Once the charm is used, it vanishes from you.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Chaos Charm
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can expend this charm to roll on the Wild Magic Sorcery's {@table Wild Magic Surge|XPHB} table, creating the corresponding magical effect.
{@note Made by Christopher}

reward.name: Love is in the Air?
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action you can expend this charm to fill a 30-foot radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on yourself with {@hazard Poisonous Gas|XDMG}. The gas lasts for 1 minute or until it's dispersed by a strong wind.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Minor Blessing
entries: A god has noticed your prayers or some great deed you've undertaken, and given you their divine blessing.

When you receive this charm, the GM determines which ability is blessed. When you would fail a Skill Check which uses the blessed ability, you may use this charm to increase the result of the roll by 10.
{@note Made by Gavin}

reward.name: Nah, I Can't...
entries: As a Bonus Action, you drop to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. Once you do so, this Charm disappears from you.
{@note Made by Christopher}

reward.name: No, Thank you!
entries: Too Scary! - As a Reaction to anything, you can immediately teleport to back to the guild and leave the session. You don't get any Rewards. After you use this ability, the charm fades away.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Nothing Ever Happens
entries: {@i Well, would you look at the time...}

When a GM rolls on a random encounter table, you can expend a charge of this charm to instead have them roll a {@dice d100}. On a 1-36, nothing happens. On a 36-75, nothing happens. On a 75-99, nothing happens. On a 100, something happens, and they can roll again on their table.
While you have this charm, burgers are tasteless.
This charm comes with {@dice 1d4} charges. Once the last charge is expended, it disappears in a thoroughly disappointing and anticlimactic way.
{@note Repassing from S3, Made by Ryan}

reward.name: Something Just Happened
entries: If you, the player, are aware of something happening that your character isn't, such as due to a party split, you can use an action to use this charm to roll a DC 15 Constitution ({@skill Perception}) check. On a success, your character knows that Something Just Happened, as well as a general direction to where it happened, but absolutely no further information. Once used, this charm vanishes from you.
{@note Repassing from WM3, Made by V}

reward.name: Something Will Happened
entries: When a GM rolls for a Recharge ability, you can use this charm to have it automatically recharge the ability instead. Once you use this charm, it vanishes from you.
{@i I think something will happen!}
{@note Repassing from WM3, Made by Landon}

reward.name: Sorgy...
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action you can cast {@spell Ceremony|XGE} targeting yourself, using the rite of Atonement. Once used the charm is expended.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: We Can Be Bees
entries: {@i This is good news.}

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can activate this charm, casting the {@spell Animal Shapes|XPHB} spell. When you cast it this way, the creature that is chosen to transform into is a giant bee (using {@spell Giant Wasp|XMM} statistics). The charm vanishes after you activate it.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: What are we gonna do?!?
entries: You can cast {@spell Divination|XPHB} as a {@action Magic|XPHB} Action with this charm. When you do so, you can only ask about how to accomplish a goal or activity within the next 30 minutes. Once you do so, this Charm disappears from you.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Wurm
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action you become a worm. After a minute you revert back to your normal form.
This charm disappears after you become a worm.
{@note Made by Laz}

reward.name: 🗿
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action you can expend this charm to give yourself the {@condition Petrified} condition.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: A Name Given
entries: {@note Special Curse}

You have given your name to a fey. You have Disadvantage on all attack rolls made against the fey and {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on saving throws against the fey's magic. No one is able to remember your name, or speak it. Any written mention of the name becomes incomprehensible.
As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, the fey is able to perfectly disguise itself as you. It can drop the disguise at any time (no action required).
This curse can only be cursed by dealing with the fey who took the name, or by casting {@spell Legal Name Change|WM4}, permanently replacing the stolen name with a new one.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: All That's Left
entries: You are unable to turn right.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Big and Full
entries: Every sentence you say must begin with "Ouuuh I'm so ___"
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Cat got your tongue?
entries: You cannot speak, only meow.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Chronal Anomaly
entries: {@note Special Curse}
You are caught between multiple time streams, all flowing in different directions.

When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, roll {@dice 2d10}. If the total is an even number, your age decreases by that amount, leaving you no younger than 15 years old. If the total is an odd number, you increase in age by that amount.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Cyclonically Rupturable
entries: You are considered to be a Pistol for the purposes of the {@reward Cyclone Rupture|WM4} Talent.
{@note Made by Ellie}

reward.name: Dysphoria
entries: An overwhelming dissatisfaction engulfs you. You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on all Ability Checks and Attack Rolls. Participating in an activity that brings you joy lifts the curse for 1 minute.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Ego Death
entries: {@note Special Curse}
You have lost who you are. Your memories feel disconnected and unlike yourself. A part of you is missing. You and everything you carry appears in grayscale.
This curse can only be cured by finding yourself.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Endless Dreamer
entries: {@i Special Curse}
Your dreams often stretch on endlessly, and years could pass in your dreams when only hours pass in reality. You remember most of your dreams, even if somewhat hazy.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Felt by its Embrace
entries: {@i Have my company. Feel my warmth. You are alone no longer.}

Whenever you would be reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you instead drop to 1 Hit Point and transform and lose control. Your skin begins to constantly shed blood and transform into an Aberrant Cultist as if through {@spell True Polymorph|XPHB}.

While in this form, whenever you choose a creature as a target, you must choose the target at random from among the creatures you can see within range of the attack, spell, or other ability it's using. If an enemy provokes an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB}, you must make the attack if you are able to.
If you lose the {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} granted by the transformation, you die and your body returns to normal ending the Curse.
{@note Made by Althaea and Gem}

reward.name: Hard Mode
entries: {@note Special Curse}
Whenever you make a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you roll a {@dice d12} instead of a {@dice d20}.
{@note Made by Christopher}

reward.name: Impotence
entries: You are incapable of Zerking it (or Zoarkin'auffe).
{@note Made by Ellie}

reward.name: It's just gonna ask you a couple of questions...
entries: Whenever you make a purchase, you have to pay an additional 20%.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Lycanthropy (Bat)
entries: {@i You are heavily swayed to a Neutral Evil alignment, and gain minor bat features.}

entries.name: Shape-Shift
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can shape-shift into a Large {@creature Giant Bat|XMM} or Medium Bat-Hybrid.  While a {@creature Giant Bat|XMM} or Medium Bat-Hybrid, you have a {@sense Blindsight|XPHB} of 60 feet and a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} of 60 feet.  Your game statistics are otherwise the same in each form, though you cannot speak if you are a {@creature Giant Bat|XMM}. Any equipment you are wearing or carrying isn't transformed. Worn equipment functions as normal, but the DM decides whether it's practical for the new form to wear or wield a piece of equipment. You can use another {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to shape-shift back.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity.
entries: While you are a {@creature Giant Bat|XMM} or Bat Hybrid and are in sunlight, you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Bite
entries: While you are a {@creature Giant Bat|XMM} or Bat Hybrid, you manifest a natural weapon. It counts as a simple melee weapon for you, and you add your Dexterity modifier to the attack and damage when you attack with it.

It deals {@dice 2d8} piercing damage on a hit. A damaged creature is subjected to the following effect. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 14. Failure: The target gains this curse. Success: The target is immune to your curse for 24 hours. A creature automatically succeeds if it cannot become a Lycanthrope, like most non-Humanoids.
{@note Formatted like Landon's Lycanthropy curse, Made by Marvin}

reward.name: Lycanthropy (Rat)
entries: {@i You are heavily swayed to a Lawful Evil alignment, and gain minor rat features.}

entries.name: Shape-Shift
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can shape-shift into a Small Rat or Medium Rat-Hybrid. Your game statistics are the same in each form, though you cannot speak if you are a Rat. Any equipment you are wearing or carrying isn't transformed. Worn equipment functions as normal, but the DM decides whether it's practical for the new form to wear or wield a piece of equipment. You can use another {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to shape-shift back.

entries.name: Bite
entries: While you are a Rat or Rat-Hybrid, you manifest a natural weapon. It counts as a simple melee weapon for you, and you add your Dexterity modifier to the attack and damage rolls when you attack with it.

It deals {@dice 1d6} piercing damage on a hit. A damaged creature is subjected to the following effect. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 11. Failure: The target gains this curse. Success: The target is immune to your curse for 24 hours. A creature automatically succeeds if it cannot become a Lycanthrope, like most non-Humanoids.
{@note Formatted like Landon's Lycanthropy curse, Made by Marvin}

reward.name: Lycanthropy (shark)
entries: {@i You are heavily swayed to a Neutral Evil alignment, become a Monstrosity (Lycanthrope), and gain minor shark-like features.}

entries.name: Shape-Shift
entries: As a Bonus Action, you can shape-shift into a Shark or Shark-Hybrid. While a Shark or Shark-Hybrid, you have a blindsight of 30 feet, a swim speed of 40 feet. While as a Shark-Hybrid, you can breathe air and water. While as a Shark, you are Large and can breathe only underwater. Your game statistics are otherwise the same in each form, though you cannot speak if you are a Shark. Any equipment you are wearing or carrying isn't transformed. Worn equipment functions as normal, but the DM decides whether it's practical for the new form to wear or wield a piece of equipment. You can use another Bonus Action to shape-shift back.

entries.name: Bite
entries: While you are a Shark or Shark Hybrid, you manifest a natural weapon. It counts as a simple melee weapon for you, and you add your Strength modifier to the attack and damage rolls when you attack with it, as normal. You have advantage on attack rolls with this weapon against {@status Bloodied|XPHB} creatures.

It deals {@dice 2d8} piercing damage on a hit. A damaged creature is subjected to the following effect. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 14. Failure: The target gains this curse. Success: The target is immune to your curse for 24 hours. A creature automatically succeeds if it cannot become a Lycanthrope, like most non-Humanoids.

entries.name: Transformation
entries: When you start your turn next to a {@status bloodied|XPHB} enemy, you must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, you lose control of yourself and shape-shift into a Shark or Shark-Hybrid, and cannot shape-shift back into your true form until there are no {@status Bloodied|XPHB} creatures other than you within 120 feet of you. You have no memory of your actions during this time, the GM having control over those actions instead.
{@note Formatted like Landon's Lycanthropy curse, Made by Aris}

reward.name: Nonverbal
entries: You cannot speak or perform verbal components, and any telepathic communications from you become garbled into emojis.
{@note Made by Ellie}

reward.name: Oiled Up
entries: Your hair and skin is constantly oily. You sweat oil.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Ough, so covered in honey...
entries: You are covered in honey, thus attracting many insects- especially bees- and the occasional bear. This is just unpleasant.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Pacifist
entries: You are unable to take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action and cannot knowingly do harm to other creatures.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Pig Snout, Eternal
entries: You grow a beautiful, snuffling pig snout. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell. In addition, you gain great fondness of truffles; when you catch a whiff of one, you cannot help but disregard everything you were doing just to find and devour it.
{@note Based on Pig Snout. Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Pirate Speak
entries: Yargh, yer language been set to Sea Dog! Ye gotta speak like ye've got scurvy now!
{@note Made by Christopher}

reward.name: Pretty Bad Medicine, Actually
entries: {@i This is serious, asshole.}
Whenever you, the player, laugh, your character takes {@dice 1d6} psychic damage.
{@note Inspired by Legends of Avantris, Made by Lily}

reward.name: Rainy Day
entries: A rain cloud follows above you, constantly keeping you soaked. When the water touches any creature or object you aren't carrying, it vanishes. If you get angry, the cloud starts to storm.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Rule of Hospitality
entries: You are forced to be very polite. Say please and thank you. Don't start fights in a home. Open doors for others. If you are in someone else's home, you must defend them from attackers.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Rule of Ownership
entries: You are unable to take anything that isn't yours without permission from the owner.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Rule of Reciprocity
entries: Whenever someone gives you a gift, favor, or similar, you must give them something equal in return.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Slop.
entries: {@i Step 1: Slop. Step 2: Slop. Step 3: Slop. Repeat from Step 1 until thoroughly Slopped.}
Whenever you craft an item from an Artisan's Tool, it turns into useless* Slop.
{@note *Note: Not all might find this useless}
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Tears of Sorrow
entries: {@i Special Curse}

You cannot stop crying. Everything that was; every wish for what could've been; the yearn of what you could be; all of these reverberate through your mind- through each action you take- as an incessant reminder of your loss and grief. These tears are shed and you cannot bring yourself to cease them.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Terminal Terminal Velocity
entries: There is no longer a maximum amount of damage you take from the Falling Hazard.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: The Cheese Touch
entries: {@note Special Curse}
When you touch another creature, they gain this curse and you lose it. You cannot transfer the curse to the creature who bestowed it onto you.
This curse cannot be cured by any means.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: The Eeper
entries: When you fall {@condition Unconscious}, you are unable to be woken up until you have slept for 8 hours.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: The Influencerrr
entries: The only Action you can take is the {@action Influence|XPHB} action.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: The MacLeod Effect
entries: Whenever you succeed on a Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) check made to {@action Hide|XPHB}, Sneaky Snitch plays from around you and can be heard in a 30 foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from yourself.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Think Before You Speak
entries: You can only speak when what you're about to say aligns with the attribute(s) determined by the GM when you receive this curse (ie. true, helpful, inspiring, necessary, kind).
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: This is so sad…
entries: Every time you are sad, Despacito plays loudly.
{@note Made by Tyler}

reward.name: Time to Get a Watch
entries: You always know the location of the nearest clock and can hear it ticking, as long as there is a clock on the same plane of existence as you
{@note Made by Ellie}

reward.name: Tongue of Lily
entries: When annoyed or angry, you must speak with a southern accent.
{@note Made by Ellie}

reward.name: Uncertain
entries: You are only able to speak in questions. Failing to do so causes you to take {@dice 1d6} Necrotic damage that cannot be reduced, and prevents any other creature from hearing what you said.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Vile Damage
entries: {@i Special Curse}

Vile damage is a special curse. Every point of vile damage reduces your current hit points by 1. These lost hit points can only be restored by healing magic in a consecrated area such as the Hallow spell. Vile damage represents such an evil violation to a character’s body or soul that only in a holy place can healing magic repair the damage.
Vile damage is usually done in increments of 1 damage per infliction
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Voice of the Nerd
entries: You must speak with a nasally voice. In addition, you have an intense urge to correct people when they're wrong, and often start such corrections with "ermm, actually".
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Welcoming Party
entries: You are unable to enter a room without being invited in. You are compelled to invite anyone you see into your home.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: You First.
entries: Whether it's because you are aura farming, are overly polite, or just have a godlike reaction speed, whenever you would roll initiative, you instead get an initiative of 0. If you still go before someone else, you can point and laugh at them.
{@note Made by Christopher}

reward.name: Seismic Empath
entries: You've cultivated a deep connection with the earth and its volcanic power.

{@b Forewarning.} When you see a volcano that's at least 1 mile away, you can take the {@action Search|XPHB} action to make a DC 20 Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check. If you succeed, you know if the volcano will erupt within the next 7 days.

{@b Seismic Detection.} You have {@sense Tremorsense|XPHB} out to 60 feet. In addition, you detect the presence of seismic activity with your {@sense Tremorsense|XPHB}, to a depth that reaches the center of Toril.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Adaptable Artillery
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}
You can treat every ranged weapon as if it were a Simple melee weapon of your choice.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Assassin's Mark
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}, Hunter's Mark}
If you hit a creature marked by your Hunter's Mark with a weapon attack, you can choose to end the Hunter's Mark on the creature. If you do so, your attack deals an extra {@dice 4d6} damage.
If you have Foe Slayer, this instead becomes {@dice 4d10} damage.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Blessing of Increased Ability
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}
Choose an Ability Score. It increases by 2, up to a maximum of 20.
When you finish a long rest, you can change which Ability Score you increase with this gift.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Brutal Thrower
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}
You treat every melee weapon as if it has the thrown property with a range of (20/60). After you make an attack, the weapon magically returns to your hand.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Bulwark
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}, Unarmored Defense}
You add your Strength Modifier to your Unarmored Defense calculations.
{@note Made by V}

reward.name: Cerebrant
entries: {@i You've called out to the Far Realm as a hope to harness some of its power for yourself; the Far Realm responded.}

{@b Aching Dread.} Unfelt, your form subtly alters the psychological landscape of the surrounding aether. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can cause the alterations to flare. Creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition Frightened} of you until the end of your next turn. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, regaining expended uses after you complete a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

{@b Call Farspawn.} You call upon horrible entities from the Far Realm to your aid, casting {@spell Summon Aberration|XPHB} (Level 4 version). Once you cast this spell, you cannot do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

All DCs in this gift are equal to 8 + your Proficiency Bonus + your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier (determined by you when you receive this gift), spellcasting ability is equal to your Proficiency Bonus + the same ability modifier as the DCs.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Close Quarters Defense
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}

When a creature within 5 feet of you attempts to {@condition Grappled|XPHB|Grapple} you or subject you to an effect that would {@condition Grappled|XPHB|Grapple} you, you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against that creature. If you hit, you deal {@dice 1d6} extra damage, and you automatically succeed against the effect.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Cram Study
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}

When you finish a Long Rest, you can choose {@skill Arcana}, {@skill History}, {@skill Investigation}, {@skill Nature}, or {@skill Religion}. If you do not have Proficiency in that Skill, you gain Proficiency with that skill until the end of your next long rest. If you did have Proficiency, when you take the {@action study|XPHB|Study Action}, you have Advantage on Intelligence checks involving that Skill.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Dirty Tactics
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}

As a Bonus Action, you can throw irritating particles at a creature within 10 feet of you. It must make a Dexterity Saving throw, or become {@condition Blinded} until the end of your turn. The saving throw is equal to 8 + Your Proficiency Modifier + Your Dexterity modifier.
Additionally, you have a +1 bonus to weapon damage rolls against {@condition Prone} creatures.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Dropkick of Doom
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@reward Special Technique: Dropkick!|WM4} talent}

When you dropkick a creature, the creature is pushed 5 feet away from you if it is no more than one size larger than you. In addition, you may make any of your unarmed strikes into a dropkick attack, instead of one per turn.
{@note Made by Patrick}

reward.name: Dungeon Adept
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}
You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) and Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) checks made to detect the presence of secret doors.
You have advantage on saving throws made to avoid or resist traps.
You have resistance to the damage dealt by traps.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Eldritch Akimbo
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}, Pact of the Blade Invocation}
Your Pact of the Blade invocation can sustain two weapons at the same time, allowing you to keep up the pressure with dual-wielded weapons.
{@note Made by Lily}

reward.name: Empowered Turning
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}, Channel Divinity (Turn Undead)}
The range of your Turn Undead is increased to 60 feet, and undead within 15 feet of you have disadvantage on the saving throw.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Enduring Focus
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}, Flurry of Blows}
The first time you use Flurry of Blows after a short or long rest, you can do so without expending focus points. Additionally, you gain 2 more focus points to your total pool.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Expanded Cunning Strikes
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}, Cunning Strike}
You have the following options added to your Cunning Strike feature:

entries.name: Lacerate (cost 1d6).
entries: The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or suffer {@dice 3d6} Piercing damage at the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Hamstring (cost 2d6).
entries: The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have its speed reduced by 15 feet.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Eyes of Light and Darkness
entries: {@b Ebon Gaze.} As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can tune your eyes to see through the darkest darkness. For the next 10 minutes, you can see in Darkness—both magical and nonmagical—within 60 feet of yourself as if it was {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB}. Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

{@b Dazzling Gaze.} As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can cause your eyes to erupt as pools of radiance. For the next minute, your eyes sheds {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} in a 20-foot radius and {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} for an additional 20 feet; as an action on each of your turns, you can concentrate your gaze onto a creature within 40 feet of you. That creature has to succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + prof bonus + con mod) or be {@condition Blinded} until the end of its next turn. Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Familiar Familiarity
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}
You always have the {@spell Find Familiar|XPHB} spell prepared. Additionally, you can cast it without expending a spell slot, but you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Fast Reader
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}, {@class Wizard}}
You can read twice as quickly as most people, and it takes you only half the time to copy spells into your book.
{@note Made by Lily}

reward.name: First Move
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}
Your movement {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 10 feet. Whenever you take the {@action Disengage|XPHB} action, you are able to move through all creatures as if they were your allies.
Whenever you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, you can immediately move up to your movement {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Hefty Spellbook
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}, {@class Wizard|XPHB}}
You can prepare an extra number of spells equal to your Intelligence modifier.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Hotswapper
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}
Whenever you roll initiative, you may immediately draw a weapon, and the first attack roll you make that combat has advantage. Additionally, you can don or doff a shield as an object interaction.
{@note Made by Lily}

reward.name: Malleable Illusions
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}, Spellcasting}

When you cast an illusion spell that has a duration of 1 minute or longer, you can use a Magic Action to change the nature of that illusion (using the spell's normal parameters for the illusion), provided that you can see the illusion.
{@note Made by Gavin}

reward.name: Negotiator
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}

You do not suffer {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on {@action Influence|XPHB} checks you make against {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} creatures. Whenever you take an {@action Influence|XPHB} action to make a Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) and pass, you gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the next Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check you make against that creature in the next hour.
Whenever you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, you gain the effects of {@spell Sanctuary|XPHB} for 1 minute (DC equals 8 + your Proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier).
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Paladin's Wrath
entries: {@i Replaces the Paladin's Smite feature}

You always have the {@spell Wrathful Smite|XPHB} spell prepared. When you cast {@spell Wrathful Smite|XPHB}, you deal Radiant damage instead of Necrotic, and you cast it as though it used a spell slot 2 levels higher, to a maximum of level 5. In addition, you can cast it without using a spell slot, but you must finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} before you can cast it this way again.
{@note Made by Gavin}

reward.name: Polyglot
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}
Whenever you finish a short or long rest, you can choose a Language to know until you finish another short or long rest.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Powerful Shove
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}
Whenever a creature fails the saving throw against being Shoved by you, you can have it take bludgeoning damage equal to your strength modifier.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Skim Reader
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}, {@class Wizard|XPHB|Memorize Spell}}

As a {@action Study|XPHB} action, you can study your spellbook and replace one of the level 1-5 Wizard spells you have prepared for your Spellcasting feature with another level 1-5 spell from the book. The next time you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, you do not benefit from Memorize Spell. You cannot take this action again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Sparks of Magic
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}

You always have {@spell Dancing Lights}, {@spell Elementalism|XPHB}, {@spell Mending}, {@spell Prestidigitation}, and {@spell Thaumaturgy} prepared. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this feat's spells (choose when you select this Gift).
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Spellbreaker
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}

When a creature within reach casts a spell, you can use your reaction to make a melee attack with a weapon or an Unarmed Strike against that creature. On a hit, it must make a saving throw to maintain Concentration. On a failure, the creature's spell fails and has no effect. The action, Bonus Action, or Reaction used to cast it is wasted and, if the spell was cast using a spell slot, the slot is also wasted.
As with any saving throw to maintain Concentration, the DC equals 10 or half the damage the creature takes, whichever number is higher, to a maximum DC of 30.
{@note Adapted from MW3. Made by V}

reward.name: Spellheart
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Spellcasting feature}
If you have no spell slots remaining for an entire minute, you regain a 1st level spell slot.
Sorcerers cannot convert slots regained in this way into sorcery points. These slots cannot be used to refuel uses of other features, such as Wild Resurgence or Font of Inspiration.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Strong Upbringing
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}
You gain an Origin feat of your choice.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Tactical Opportunist
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}

Whenever you make an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Attack Of Opportunity} against a creature, you can choose to roll at advantage. If you land this attack, all allies within 15 feet of the creature gain a +1 bonus to their attack and damage rolls against the creature until the start of the creature's next turn.
You can use this ability a number of times equal to half of your Proficiency Bonus (rounded down), and regain expended uses at the end of a short or long rest.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Vestigial Wings
entries: Your {@variantrule High Jump|XPHB} is increased by 20 feet, and your {@variantrule Long Jump|XPHB} is increased by 40 feet. In addition, if you fall and your speed is not 0, you can slow your rate of descent to 60 feet per round. When you land you can take no damage from the fall and can land on your feet.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Vexing Mark
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}, Hunter's Mark}
Creatures affected by your Hunter's Mark subtract {@dice 1d4} from their saving throws against your spells.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Winter's Gift
entries: {@i You've learned to harness some of the powers of winter.}
{@b Frost Treader.} You ignore the penalties of {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} imposed by snow or ice.

{@b Icebrand.} As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can infuse your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} with chilling cold. For the next minute, your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} deal an additional {@dice 1d6} Cold damage. This ends early if you are subject to Fire damage. Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Blessing of the Witches Extraordinaire.
entries: {@i The Witches Extraordinaire offered you a gift, and you accepted. A spark of possibility exists within you, and with your careful nurturing, it can explode into great power.}

{@b Latent Possibility.} When you receive this gift, choose one of your skill proficiencies. When you make an Ability Check associated with the skill, instead of adding your ability modifier and Proficiency bonus, you roll a {@dice d6} and add it to the {@dice d20}. If you roll a 6 on the {@dice d6}, the dice explodes, allowing you to roll another {@dice d6} and add it to the result, possibly exploding again.

{B Spark of Heroism.} After making the Ability Check, if the extra dice exploded, the dice size changes. A {@dice d6} becomes a {@dice d8}, a {@dice d8} becomes a {@dice d10}, and a {@dice d10} becomes a {@dice d12} (Exploding on a roll of 8, 10, and 12 respectively). Whenever you use Latent Possibility, you roll the new dice instead of the {@dice d6}. If the dice was a {@dice d12}, instead of increasing in size, you gain {@variantrule Heroic Inspiration|XPHB}, the dice becomes a {@dice d6}, and you cannot benefit from Spark of Heroism until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}.
{@note Made by Vic}

reward.name: Cerebrant Fester
entries: {@i You've called out to the Far Realm as a hope to harness some of its power for yourself; the Far Realm responded.}

{@b Aching Dread.} Unfelt, your form subtly alters the psychological landscape of the surrounding aether. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can cause the alterations to flare. Creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition Frightened} of you until the end of your next turn. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, regaining expended uses after you complete a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

{@b Call Farspawn.} You call upon horrible entities from the Far Realm to your aid, casting {@spell Summon Aberration|XPHB} (Level 4 version). Once you cast this spell, you cannot do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

{@b Dimensional Rift.} You can cast {@spell Dimension Door|XPHB}. When you do so, roll {@dice 1d100}. On a 1, you are stolen away by horrible entities forever; if another creature was brought along by the spell, they arrive at the target destination. Once you cast {@spell Dimension Door|XPHB}, you cannot do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

All DCs in this gift are equal to 8 + your Proficiency Bonus + your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier (determined by you when you receive this gift), spellcasting ability is equal to your Proficiency Bonus + the same ability modifier as the DCs.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Vistani Evil Eye
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Spellcasting Class Feature}

entries.name: Vistani Curse Magic.
entries: You learn the spell {@spell Bestow Curse|XPHB} and always have it prepared. When you cast it this way, you instead make a Ranged Spell Attack with a Range of 30 feet, casting it at its Level 3 version. When the target fails the saving throw, you alternatively choose the nature of the curse from the following options:

items: The target is unable to perform a certain kind of act involving fine motor control, such as tying knots, writing, playing an instrument, sewing, or casting spells that have Somatic components. When this curse ends, you take {@dice 2d6} Psychic damage.

The target's appearance changes in a sinister yet purely cosmetic way. For example, the curse can place a scar on the target's face, turn the target's teeth into yellow fangs, or give the target bad breath. When this curse ends, you take {@dice 2d6} Psychic damage.

A nonmagical item in the target's possession (chosen by the DM) disappears and can't be found until the curse ends. The lost item can weigh no more than 1 pound. When this curse ends, you take {@dice 2d6} Psychic damage.
The target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on ability checks and saving throws tied to one ability score of your choice. When this curse ends, you take {@dice 6d6} Psychic damage.
The target's attunement to one magic item of your choice ends. When this curse ends, you take {@dice 10d6} Psychic damage, and the target automatically reattunes to the item.
The target is {@condition Blinded}, {@condition Deafened}, or both (your choice). When this curse ends, you take {@dice 10d6} Psychic damage.

entries.name: Evil Eye.
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can target a creature within 10 feet that you can see. This magical ability, which the Vistani call the Evil Eye, duplicates the duration and effect of the {@spell Animal Friendship|XPHB}, {@spell Charm Person|XPHB}, or {@spell Hold Person|XPHB} spell (your choice), but requires neither Somatic nor Material components. If the target succeeds on the save, you are {@condition Blinded} until the end of your next turn. When you use this feature, you cannot do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
The DC for these effects uses your spellcasting DC.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Whirlwind Strike!
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Extra Attack}
{@i don't cry because it's over. attack. attack everything around you. do spin attacks}

You can do spin attacks. You can use an Action to make a Melee Weapon Attack against any number of creatures within 5 feet of you, with a separate attack roll for each target. You can make this attack twice, regaining one of its expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, and all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Horde Slayer
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 16 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 16 Reward}}

When an attack you make reduces a creature to 0 hit points, you can target another creature within range and, if the original attack roll can hit it, applies any remaining damage to it. If that creature is likewise reduced to 0 hit points, repeat this process, carrying over the remaining damage until there are no valid targets, or until the damage carried over fails to reduce a creature to 0 hit points.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Master of All Weapons
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 16 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 16 Reward}, Fighter}
You have mastery in all weapons.

entries.name: A Little Bit of Everything.
entries: You may unequip and equip a weapon after each attack when you take the Attack Action on your turn. Once per turn, when you do this, you may attack an additional time if the weapon you equipped has a different mastery property than the one you unequipped.
{@note Made by Gavin}

reward.name: Planar Voyager
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 16 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 16 Reward}}

You always have the {@spell Plane Shift} spell prepared. When you cast it, it doesn’t require components. Additionally, you can cast it without expending a spell slot, but you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this gift (choose when you receive it).
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Positional Master
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 16 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 16 Reward}}
Immediately after you roll Initiative, you can take a Reaction to cast {@spell Scatter|XGE} without expending a spell slot.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Positive Energy Flux
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 16 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 16 Reward}; Bard, Cleric or Druid}

When you restore Hit Points to a creature with a spell, any excess healing (Hit Points not healed due to being at maximum health), the target instead receives a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to the excess healing. These Temporary Hit Points cannot exceed the target's maximum Hit Points.
These Temporary Hit Points remain for 1 minute.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Supernatural Boobs
entries: {@note Made by Tres}

reward.name: A Little Version of Me
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can touch a creature to grant it the {@reward Silly Guy|WM4} Perk, taking the form of a spirit resembling you. They keep this perk until you use this action again.
{@note Inspired by Smiling Friends. Made by Gem}

reward.name: Abyssal Influence: Bloody Ichor
entries: When you die, you leave a puddle of demon ichor in your space. It dissolves after 24 hours.
(can only be given with the players' permission)
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Anonymity
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in crowds of people.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Anuran Throat
entries: You can inflate your throat like a frog's. In addition, you can perfectly mimic the ribbit of a frog.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Arborea Influence: Merry Music
entries: Whenever you cast a spell or make a spell attack, the faint sound of merry music can be heard by you and those affected by your magic.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Beast Treats
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Beast Master}
You can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to feed your Primal Companion treats and expend a spell slot. After 1 minute, the beast has all its Hit Points restored.
(you can already do this but you have to kill the beast to do it normally)
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Big Foot Enthusiast
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can make your feet an inch longer. This can only be undone by {@spell Wish|XPHB}.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Bigby's Foot
entries: When you cast {@spell Bigby's Hand|XPHB}, you can make it look like a foot. When you make it a foot it is unable to use the Grasping Hand part of the spell.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Bigfoot Enthusiast
entries: You have Advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Nature}) checks made to identify footsteps of bare feet.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Birthday Blessing!
entries: While it is your birthday (the PC's birthday), you add {@dice 1d4} to D20 Tests.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Blessing of Corellon
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Any Elf}

{@i Ever changing, mirthful, and beautiful, the primal elves could assume whatever sex they liked. When they bowed to Lolth's influence and chose to fix their physical forms, elves lost the ability to transform in this way. Yet occasionally elves are born who are so androgynous that they are proclaimed to be among the blessed of Corellon—living symbols of the god's love and of the primal elves' original fluid state of being. Many of Corellon's chief priests bear this blessing.}

{@i The rarest of these blessed elves can change their sex whenever they finish a long rest-a miracle celebrated by elves of all sorts except drow. (The DM decides whether an elf can manifest this miracle.) Dark elves find this ability to be terrifying and characterize it as a curse, for it could destabilize their entire society. If Corellon's blessing manifests in a drow, that elf usually flees to the surface world to seek shelter among those dedicated to Corellon. (From MTF)}

You have become among the blessed of Corellon. Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can change your sex as well as minor characteristics about yourself such as your height, facial features, sound of your voice, and hair length. You cannot change your height by more than 6 inches and your size category stays the same. Whatever changes you make, you are still recognizable as yourself.
{@note Adapted from Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes. Made by Gem}

reward.name: Bodybuilder
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Strength ({@skill Performance}) checks. If you lack proficiency in {@skill Performance}, you can still add your Proficiency Bonus to Strength ({@skill Performance}) checks.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Bottleable
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Ooze}

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action you are to shrink your form in order to fit into an open bottle, flask, vial, or other tiny container. While in the bottle, you are able to be concealed by another creature, allowing you to share its Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks to remain unseen. If the container is open, you can leave it using half of your movement. If the container is nonmagically sealed, you are unable to leave but can use an action to make a DC 10 Strength saving throw in order to break out of the container. If the container is magically sealed, you are unable to break out in this way.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: By the Nine! I'm Tweaking!
entries: If you would be forced to roll on the {@table Mixing Potions; Potion Miscibility|XDMG|Potion Miscibility} table as a result of drinking a potion while already under the effects of another potion, you may choose to treat your {@dice D100} roll as a 50. When you do so, you become {@condition Paralyzed} until the end of your next turn and fall {@condition Prone}.
{@note Made by Patrick}

reward.name: Carceri Influence: Lockdown
entries: All Ropes, Chains, Manacles, and Nets while within 10 feet of you have a +5 bonus to DCs made to escape the object.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Create Wine
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Can cast {@spell Create or Destroy Water|XPHB}}

When you cast {@spell Create or Destroy Water|XPHB}, and choose the Create Water option, you can choose to make wine instead of water. It functions the same as the water, except it cannot put out exposed flames.

Additionally, you can choose how alcoholic it is. If you choose to make it excessively alcoholic, any creature who drinks it must make a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition Poisoned} for 1 hour.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Creature Feature
entries: {@i “Little did I know, It would be a creature feature. Featuring… the creature.”}
You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Charisma ({@skill Performance}) checks to portray yourself as feral or monstrous.
{@note Made by Miel}

reward.name: Dice Goblin
entries: You can attune to multiple {@item Charlatan's Die|XDMG} at once, and they all count as the same attunement.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Digital Display
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Common Sign Language, Construct}
A part of your body has been transformed into a screen. You are able to cause text to appear on the screen in any language that you understand (No action required).
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Door Buster
entries: {@i You are adept in knocking doors off their hinges}
You gain a +4 bonus to Strength checks to break down doors. This bonus does not stack with a Portable Ram.
{@note Perk of {@item Portable Ram|XPHB}, Made by Gem}

reward.name: Double-Jointed
entries: Your body is jointed in ways it shouldn't be. The difference isn't noticeable until you start moving them, but you have more joints than most and more range in the ones most people have. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on checks made to squeeze through small spaces, and you're capable of unnatural movements like spinning your head 180 degrees, bending your knee forwards, or similar slightly uncanny movements.
{@note Made by Lily}

reward.name: Draconic Diet
entries: You can consume treasure and currency of equal value to the {@item Rations|XPHB} you would need to eat when taking a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Elminster Discerning Protocol
entries: You can choose to gain a +1 bonus on an ability check made to discern whether someone with the first name Elminster is the Elminster of legend. Once you do so, you cannot use this perk again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
{@note Made by Denny}

reward.name: Elysium Influence: Adequate Chef
entries: No matter how low you roll for Wisdom ({@item Cook's Utensils|XPHB}) to prepare a meal, your food cannot taste terrible. It tastes mediocre at worst.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Enjoy the Show
entries: As a Reaction to seeing shit going down, you can conjure a red and white striped bucket full of buttery popcorn in your hand.
{@note Made by Lily}

reward.name: Ethereal Connection
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Manifest Mind}

Your Awaked Spellbook does not immediately vanish when you move to the Ethereal Plane. While you are on a different plane than it, you lose control of it and cannot use or benefit from any abilities that require it to be manifested.
The Awakened Spellbook stops manifesting after 1 minute unless you return to the same Plane as it.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Evil Brand
entries: You are physically marked forever as a servant of an evil power greater than yourself or as a villain who does not care who knows that you seek only death, destruction, and misery for others. The symbol is unquestionable in its evil, and all who see it know beyond a doubt that the bearer is forever in the sway of the blackest powers.

Evil creatures automatically recognize the symbol now emblazoned upon you as a sign of your utter depravity or discipleship to a powerful patron, although the specific identity of the patron is not revealed.
You gain a +2 bonus on {@skill Persuasion} and {@skill Intimidation} checks made against evil creatures.
{@note From 3.5e, ported by Aris}

reward.name: Evil Brand: Mark of Chains
entries: You are physically marked forever as a servant of an evil power greater than yourself or as a villain who does not care who knows that you seek only death, destruction, and misery for others. The symbol is unquestionable in its evil, and all who see it know beyond a doubt that the bearer is forever in the sway of the blackest powers.
If you already have {@reward Evil Brand|WM4} when you receive this Perk, you can choose for this Perk's features to replace {@reward Evil Brand|WM4|Evil Brand's}; else, this Perk has no effect.

Evil creatures automatically recognize the chain link symbol now emblazoned upon you as a sign of your utter depravity or discipleship to a powerful patron, although the specific identity of the patron is not revealed.
You gain a +1 bonus on your save DCs to Grapple and Escape a Grapple.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Food Feelings
entries: When you take the {@action Search|XPHB} action, you can target a creature and make a Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check against their Passive Charisma ({@skill Deception}). On a success, you learn what their Super All-Time Favorite Food is, and their Worst Most Hated Food ever is. On a failure, that creature becomes immune to this ability for 24 hours.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Fur Coat
entries: As part of a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, you can grow a thick coat of fur on your body. While you have this fur and remain dry, you automatically succeed on saving throws against the effects of extreme cold, as if you were wearing {@item Clothing, cold weather|IDROTF|cold weather clothing}. This fur remains until you cut it off.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Furry Feathered Familiar
entries: When you cast {@spell Find Familiar|XPHB}, you can summon a {@creature Tressym|BGDIA}.
{@note Made by Lily}

reward.name: Gorg is this real?
entries: When you take the {@action Study|XPHB} action, you can ask Gorg for help. He responds if he happens to be within earshot.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Gork is this real?
entries: When you take the {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can ask Gork for help. He responds if he happens to be within earshot.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Hand-Eye Coordination
entries: Your hands function as a {@item Spyglass|XPHB} when positioned in front of an eye as one.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Harmless Theatrics
entries: When you cast a spell, you can choose to deal no damage with it.
{@note Made by Lily}

reward.name: Horrible Entity
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Aberration}
You have become a horrible entity. As an Action, you can steal away an Alienist whose time has come. When you do so, they are never seen again.
This perk does not make you immune to getting taken away by other, more horrible entities.
{@note Made by Denny}

reward.name: I Hired This 🦀 To Stare At You
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can summon an {@creature Aldani (Lobsterfolk)|TOA|Aldani} in an unoccupied space that you can see within 15 feet. The {@creature Aldani (Lobsterfolk)|TOA|Aldani} remains there for 1 minute, in which it uses its time to stand there and stare at you. Once you use this perk, you cannot do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: I Hired This 🦞 To Stare At You
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can summon a Crab Folk in an unoccupied space that you can see within 15 feet. The Crab Folk remains there for 1 minute, in which it uses its time to stand there and stare at you. Once you use this perk, you cannot do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: I Own a Musket For Home Defense
entries: You have advantage on attack rolls with {@item musket|XPHB|muskets} while in your home, as the founding fathers intended.
{@note Made by Lily}

reward.name: I am a wolf.
entries: {@i On all levels except physical...}
You can perfectly recreate the howl of a wolf.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: I know what I am
entries: You can cast {@spell Detect Pronouns|WM4} at will. When cast in this way, its duration is Instantaneous and you only learn your own preferred pronouns.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: I know what you are
entries: You can cast {@spell Detect Pronouns|WM4} at will.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: If you Give an Adventurer a Cookie...
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can summon a cookie. This cookie has no mechanical benefit, but it can be a different flavor whenever you summon it, such as chocolate chip, or snickerdoodle... maybe even one of those Crumble cookies, if you feel fancy.
Once you use this ability, you cannot summon another cookie again until the end of a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}
{@note Made by Vic}

reward.name: Introspection
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks made against yourself.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Juggler
entries: When you hit another creature of one size larger than you or smaller with a weapon attack, you can cause that creature to not fall until the end of your next turn.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Kyton's Chains
entries: You can use {@item Manacles|XPHB} or {@item chain|XPHB|Chains} on a creature within 10 feet of yourself, rather than 5.
Additionally, you can use {@item chain|XPHB|Chains} as a {@item Whip|XPHB}, dealing either Bludgeoning or Slashing damage on a hit (depending on the nature of the chain).
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: LEVITATION!!!!
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@reward TRANSFORMATION!!!!|WM4} perk}

While in your TRANSFORMATION!!!!, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} ACTION!!!! (action) to shout “LEVITATION!!!!”, causing your legs to raise up into your body, leaving it hovering in the air. Your movement {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is 0 while in this form. You can shift back to your original TRANSFORMATION!!!! as a {@action Magic|XPHB} ACTION!!!! (action).
{@note Made by Miel}

reward.name: Legacy Carpenter
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@item Carpenter's Tools|XPHB} proficiency}

entries.name: Fortify.
entries: With 1 minute of work and raw materials, you can make a door or window harder to force open. Increase the DC needed to open it by 5.

entries.name: Temporary Shelter.
entries: As part of a Long Rest, you can construct a lean-to or a similar shelter to keep your group dry and in the shade for the duration of the rest. Because it was fashioned quickly from whatever wood was available, the shelter collapses {@dice 1d3} days after being assembled.
{@note From 2014, ported by Aris}

reward.name: Legacy Mason
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@item Mason's Tools|XPHB} proficiency}

entries.name: Demolition.
entries: Your knowledge of masonry allows you to spot weak points in brick walls. You deal double damage to such structures with your weapon attacks.
{@note From 2014, ported by Aris}

reward.name: Legacy Tinkerer
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@item Tinker's Tools|XPHB} proficiency}

entries.name: Repair.
entries: You can restore 10 hit points to a damaged object for each hour of work. For any object, you need access to the raw materials required to repair it. For metal objects, you need access to an open flame hot enough to make the metal pliable.
{@note From 2014, ported by Aris}

reward.name: Let’s Get This Out Onto A Tray
entries: You never tire of eating rations and have Advantage on Saving Throws against the Poisoned condition from consuming spoiled or old rations. Nice.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Looks at camera...
entries: You always know what direction to look at the camera.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Looks away from camera...
entries: You always know what direction to look away from the camera.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Mag-nificent!
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on any ability check made to appraise or inspect a highly detailed item. You can also light a fire with if you have light as bright as sunlight to focus, tinder to ignite. It takes about 5 minutes for the fire to ignite.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Melody of your Destruction
entries: You know how to perform this song (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bMW1kYrFI0M). While singing this song in the ocean, you can take the {@action Influence|XPHB} action, making a DC 50 Charisma ({@skill Performance}) check. On a success, you summon a {@creature Kraken|XMM}. It is {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} to you and tries to kill you. Once you are dead, or when it is {@status Bloodied|XPHB}, it flees. On a failure or after it flees, you are unable to attempt to summon it again for one week.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Monster Masher
entries: You have Advantage on Charisma ({@skill Performance}, {@skill Persuasion}) checks made to convince a Monstrosity or Undead to join an ongoing dance.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Musical Genius
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Proficiency in an Instrument}
You can play Instruments you are Proficient with using your feet.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Neurotoxin
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Cunning Strike, Soulknife Rogue}
You do not need a {@item Poisoner's Kit|XPHB} on your person to use the Poison option of Cunning Strike on attacks with your {@item Psychic Blade|XPHB|Psychic Blades}.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Nice Shot!
entries: When a creature within 30ft of you rolls a 20 or a 1 on a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you can use your reaction to create an illusion of the words “Nice Shot!” 1 foot in front of them.
This illusion goes away after 6 seconds have passed.
{@note Made by Marvin}

reward.name: Non-Combustible Non-Fire
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Transmuted Spell}

When you change the damage type of a spell from Fire to another type with Transmuted Spell, if the spell would cause flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried to start burning, you can have it not do so.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Non-Combustible Non-Fire but for Scribes
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Awakened Spellbook}

When you replace the damage type of a spell from Fire to another type with Awakened Spellbook, if the spell would cause flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried to start burning, you can have it not do so.
{@note Based on Landon's Perk. Modified by Gem.}

reward.name: Opening Tap
entries: You can use any hard blunt object, such as a pommel of a blade or another lock, as {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB} for the purposes of opening a nonmagical lock.
{@note Inspired by the 3.5e Opening Tap skill trick, Made by Aris}

reward.name: Owlbears are Owl Bears!
entries: You can treat {@creature owlbear|XMM|Owlbears} as Beasts for the sake of your features and spells.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Perfectly Styled
entries: Your hair is magical, being able to change and visually react depending on the situation. This effect is chosen when the perk is given out. If you gain this perk a 2nd time, the new effect replaces the previous one. If {@spell Dispel Magic|XPHB} or similar magic is cast targeting your hair, the effect stops working until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}.
Some possible effects:

items: Your hair changes color depending on your mood
Your hair grows and shrinks depending on how much health you have
Your hair becomes fire-red when you cast a spell that deals Fire damage
Your hair always blows majestically in the wind

entries: {@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Please notice me.
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Umbral Sight}
{@i "WHY DO I KEEP EVADING MY ALLIES I WANT THEM TO KNOW WHERE I AM?!?!?!"}
While entirely in {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB}, you can choose what creatures you become {@condition Invisible} to using your Umbral Sight.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Prehensile Tail
entries: You have a prehensile tail. You can hold objects and make {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} with it but cannot manipulate, wield, or use objects with your tail.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Proper Psionic Stance
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Telepathy of at least 30 feet}

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action while your hands are empty, you can place them on your temples to enter a proper psionic stance. While in this stance, you are {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}, {@condition Immobilized|WM4}, and the distance of your Telepathy increases by 10 feet. You can exit this stance at the start of your turn (No action required).
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Question for the Producer...
entries: When a session finishes, you (the player) can ask the GM 1 question. The GM must answer (though not necessarily truthfully)
{@i Wait, you could always just do this.}
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Ratapult
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Can cast {@spell Catapult|XGE}}
When you cast {@spell Catapult|XGE}, you can target a {@creature Rat|XMM} to launch instead of an object.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Rothé IRA
entries: At the end of each week, for every 1 gold piece that a {@creature Deep Rothé|MPMM|Deep Rothé} is carrying for you, 2 copper appear in its possession.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Santa Initiate
entries: You can squeeze into Chimneys as small as 1 inch and have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks made to climb in them.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Scrooge
entries: When you fall into a pile of coins, you don't suffer damage from falling. You are able to swim in piles of coins as if they were a liquid. While in a pile of coins, you have a {@variantrule Swim Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Shark Teeth
entries: You can deal Piercing damage instead of Bludgeoning damage when you make an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} with your teeth. In addition, if you lose a tooth, you regrow it in 1 hour.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Shielding Arm
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@item Shield|XPHB} Training

As an Action while your hand is empty, you can shift your stance to one of defense. While in this stance, you can use your empty hand as a donned {@item shield|XPHB}. While in this stance, you can't hold or manipulate items in that hand. You can exit this stance as an Action.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Shielding Stance
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@item Shield|XPHB} Training

As a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action while holding a weapon, you can shift the way you hold one of your weapons you are holding to a stance of defense. While in this stance, treat the weapon as a {@item shield|XPHB}. While in this stance, you can't make attacks with that weapon.

Additionally while in this stance, you can't be disarmed of that weapon, and it takes a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action to drop the weapon, thereby ending the stance. You can also exit this stance as a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Silly Guy
entries: You have a tiny spirit resembling a creature (Chosen when you receive this perk) that constantly follows you. It can emote in response to what is going on around you, but it has no statblock, cannot perform any actions, and cannot convey any useful information. The Silly Guy adapts to any environment, changing its form to accommodate including allowing it to swim, fly, or move in any other way. If it is ever more than 60 ft from you, it instantly teleports to your side.
As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action you can dismiss any number of Silly Guys you have. You can resummon any number of Silly Guys as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action.
You can receive this perk multiple times, gaining a different Silly Guy of the DMs choice each time.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Slap of Life
entries: You can take the {@action Help|XPHB} action to try to stabilize via slap a creature with 0 Hit Points, which requires a successful DC 10 Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Slop Lover
entries: All slop tastes good.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Slop eater
entries: You can eat slop with no ill effects (though this does not affect the taste). Eating a pound of slop provides enough nourishment to sustain you for a day.
{@note Made by Ellie}

reward.name: Sloppy Style
entries: When you make a Wisdom ({@item Cook's Utensils|XPHB}) check in order to prepare food, you can choose to roll a 1 on the die. When you do so the food becomes inedible, providing no nutrition.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Snowsense
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Dwarf}
You can use your stonecunning feature's {@sense Tremorsense|XPHB} while in or touching snow or ice, as well as stone.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Specific Knowledge: [Topic]
entries: You gain a +5 bonus to ability checks you make about that topic. The checks must only apply if it makes sense to apply to the topic. This bonus does not stack when using a Book.
{@note Original by Aris, Reworked by Landon}

reward.name: Spirit of Encouragement
entries: {@i In times of stress, a small incorporeal spirit manifests behind you, holding onto your back. This spirit provides encouragement and consoles negative emotions.}
When forced to make a saving throw to avoid falling into despair or otherwise allowing a form of sadness to take hold of you, you roll that saving throw with advantage.
In addition, a creature with this perk is convinced that luck is on their side, even when that might not be the case.
{@i Keep on rushing forward!}
{@note Made by Patrick}

reward.name: Spore Master
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Level 5, can cast {@spell animate dead|XPHB}}

When you cast {@spell animate dead|XPHB} targeting a corpse, you can choose to animate the corpse with spores instead of negative energy. When cast in this way, the target becomes a spore servant. A spore servant uses the {@creature zombie|XMM} statistics with the following changes:

items: The servant is a plant, not an undead
The servant's alignment becomes unaligned
The servant's Intelligence is 2 (-4) and its Charisma is 1 (-5)
The servant has {@sense blindsight} with a radius of 30 feet, and is blind beyond this radius
The servant loses the undead fortitude trait and its darkvision
The servant loses its languages

entries: You can target this spore servant with animate dead as if it was an undead creature. The spore servant remains animated for 30 days, or until it is reduced to 0 hit points. You cannot reanimate the corpse as a spore servant in this way again.
{@note Based on the spore servant template in the Monster Manual, and made in consideration of Spores Druids, which get animate dead as a spell. From S3. Made by Aris}

reward.name: Stabilizer
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@skill Medicine} Proficiency}
You can take the {@action Help|XPHB} action to stabilize an Unconscious creature that has 0 Hit Points without needing to make a Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check.
{@note Perk of {@item Healer's Kit|XPHB}. Made by Gem}

reward.name: Street Juggler
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@reward Juggling Training|WM4}}
You can use any object or item that weighs less than 1 lb as a {@item Juggling Club|WM4}.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: TRANSFORMATION!!!!
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Aarakocra, Kenku, Owlin}

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} ACTION!!!! (action), you can shout “TRANSFORMATION!!!!” to shift to a different form with long, slender legs, otherwise reminiscent of your standard appearance. Your speech patterns shift to encourage exclamative OBSERVATIONS!!!! of SITUATIONS!!!!, generally as single nouns ending in -tion. You can shift back as a {@action Magic|XPHB} ACTION!!!! (action).
{@note Made by Miel}

reward.name: Tactical Backflip
entries: Whenever you're subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw, you can take a Reaction to do a cool backflip. If you do, you get a -1 penalty to that saving throw.
{@note Made by Christopher}
