entries: {@i This magical quill is able to create {@item map|XPHB|maps} for you, freeing up your hands for important adventuring duties.}

The automapper is able to draft rudimentary {@item map|XPHB|maps} as you travel, as if through {@item Cartographer's Tools|XPHB}. It is able to scribe a visible area up to 150 feet away from you. If you are traveling at a Fast pace, the automapper is unable to keep up with your movement, not producing a {@item map|XPHB|maps}.
The automapper creates maps in 1 square mile pages. It can be enabled or disabled as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Bells of Orthys
entries: When played, these bells ring with off-kilter, faint ethereal music that to those that hear it, believe it to originate from somewhere far away, in the opposite direction of the bells. All creatures within a mile can hear this music.

entries.name: Call of Carceri.
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can play this bell and target a creature within 1000 feet that can hear the bell's music. The creature must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature is {@condition Charmed}. While {@condition Charmed}, the creature believes that following the music leads to its heart's desire, and it must spend 2 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves when moving towards you. This Charm effect lasts 1 minute. If a creature passes its save, it is Immune to this property for 24 hours and cannot hear the music. Demodands automatically pass their save.
If a Bard casts a spell as an action while holding this item, they can play the bell as part of that action.

entries.name: Sin Swamp.
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can cast either the {@spell Insect Plague|XPHB} or {@spell Transmute Rock|XGE} (rock to mud) spells. This property of the bells can't be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Curse.
entries: While Attuned to this item, you have the following flaw: "I care most for myself, and I am willing to use deceit and betrayal to achieve my goals."
{@note Made by Aris}

item.name: Black Candle
entries: {@i This black wax candle burns with a faint, shadowy flame that sheds no light. The wax never diminishes, and the cold iron chamberstick that holds it is perpetually cool to the touch.}

While you are attuned to the Black Candle and are holding it, the candle automatically ignites and remains lit. It continues to burn for up to 8 hours when not held, upon which the flame extinguishes. While the candle is lit, you are immune to the effects of any curses affecting you. This does not prevent you from being cursed—any curses you gain while the candle is lit take effect once the flame is extinguished.

In addition, while holding the lit candle, you can end your attunement to a cursed magic item at will, as long as it can be ended by a {@spell Remove Curse|XPHB} spell. This property does not remove the curse itself, nor does it end any other magical effects of the cursed item.
{@note Based on The Binding of Isaac: Repentance. Made by Miel}

item.name: Blindfold of True Darkness
entries: You gain a {@sense Blindsight} of 30 feet while wearing this blindfold, and you are {@condition Blinded|XPHB|Blind} beyond that radius. You are also immune to gaze weapons. You can't use vision in any way while wearing this blindfold. Donning or doffing this blindfold takes 1 minute to do.
{@note From 3.5e and S3, Made by Aris}

item.name: Bone Heart
entries: {@i A fragile vessel for health, a bony cage that increases vitality while it remains intact.}

entries.name: Fragile Vitality.
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you gain 5 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}. When your {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} are reduced to 0 due to taking damage, you may negate any additional damage dealt to your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, upon which the Bone Heart crumbles and is consumed.
{@note Based on The Binding of Isaac: Repentance. Made by Miel}

item.name: Bottomless Bag of Bullets
entries: This bag contains an endless number of mundane {@item Firearm Bullet|XPHB|Firearm Bullets} and {@item Sling Bullet|XPHB|Sling Bullets}. Any ammo drawn from the bag disappears after it hits a target, or 1 minute after it is removed from the bag.
You can draw any item the bag contains as if doing so from a regular bag or pouch.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Candy Coaster
entries: {@i The Candy Coaster is Santa's second choice vehicle behind his signature sleigh. This classic two wheeled vehicle is covered in red and white stripes.}

The Candy Coaster functions as a vehicle (Statblock below). When the Candy Coaster reaches 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, it isn't destroyed instead breaking into pieces. A creature Proficient with {@item Smith's Tools|XPHB} can repair the Candy Coaster causing it to regain all its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} as part of a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. This costs components worth 200 gp which can be bought in any major city.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Cloak of the Embrace
entries: {@i You're alone. Let the chorus of arms help you.}

While a creature is {@condition Grappled} by your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, it is also {@condition Charmed} by you. At the end of each of its turns, the creature can make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw, ending the {@condition Charmed} condition on a success. A creature that passes the save is immune to the cloak for 24 hours.
{@note Made by Althaea & Gem}

item.name: Crystal Shield
entries: While holding this Shield, you have a +4 bonus to Armor Class, in addition to the Shield's normal bonus to AC.

The AC bonus this shield provides decreases by 1 each time an attack misses you while you have this shield equipped. When the bonus this shield provides reaches 0, the shield shatters and is destroyed.
{@note Inspired by Barony, Made by Patrick}

item.name: Dagger of Torment
entries: {@i Few of these blades remain, as many heroes of the past worked to destroy the majority of these terrible weapons.}

entries.name: Glimpse of Dread.
entries: When you hit an attack against a creature using this weapon, you can force that creature to make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature perceives you as an animated corpse, often that of the creature's loved ones, and is {@condition Dazed|WM4} until the start of your next turn. You can use this feature three times. Expended uses are regained nightly at midnight. Creatures with {@sense Truesight|XPHB} or have Immunity to the {@condition Frightened} condition are Immune to this feature.

entries.name: Visions of Torment.
entries: You can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to curse a creature that has been under the effects Glimpse of Dread in the past hour. That creature must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be plagued by visions of what they've seen. An affected creature suffers a -2 to all {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests} for the next hour. A casting of {@spell Remove Curse|XPHB} ends the effect. Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until midnight.
{@note Made by Chrys}

item.name: Disposable Stun Prod
entries: {@i “A single-use, short-range high-voltage electroshock weapon. Can be used one-handed.”}

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, all creatures in a 5-foot Emanation originating from you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become {@condition Stunned|XPHB} until the start of your next turn.
{@note From SIGNALIS, Made by Althaea}

item.name: Dryad's Sandals
entries: You can move through {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} composed of vegetation, such as foliage and thorns, without it costing extra movement.

Additionally once per turn while wearing these boots, you can walk into any inanimate plant of a size category larger than you, and immediately exit out of another plant of that size or larger within 60 ft of yourself by using 5 feet of movement.
{@note Taken (accidentally) from Pathfinder, Made by Gem}

item.name: Environment Emulator
entries: {@i Originally designed by a group of kobold tinkerers, this device has seen widespread use for its simulation ability. Many report that it is the most practical way to get hands-on training in any environment, often used for exercise, spars, and military training. Some have attempted to use it as a home, but its illusionary nature and bad upkeep time results in this being impractical.}

It takes 8 hours to enable an Environment Emulator. While enabled, the emulator is immovable and indiscernible. A creature can spend 10 minutes to disable it. If {@spell Dispel Magic|XPHB} is cast on it, it also disables.

While enabled, a creature can spend 1 minute to cast {@spell Mirage Arcane|XPHB} centered on the emulator. When cast in this way, it can only cover a 200 foot square and the spell has a duration of 10 minutes. The emulator glows blue if a creature within the illusion is using {@sense Truesight} to see through it.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Gray Zapinator
entries: {@i The pistol shoots beams of light instead of bullets. It might be broken.}
This pistol produces its own ammo and deals Radiant damage.

Every time you make an attack with this weapon, roll on the table for what effect occurs. If you roll multiple times, apply any rolled effects in the order you roll them. Multiple of the same effect stack, however a creature only makes a saving throw once taking all the stacked effects on a failure. Whenever you shoot this weapon, the GM can decide it jams and stops functioning until the next dawn.

entries.caption: Zapinator Effect
rows: {@i The beam flies off randomly.} The attack misses and you stop rolling effects
{@i The beam shoots backwards out of the gun.} You make the attack against yourself instead of its original target
{@i The beam teleports towards a random creature.} The target of the attack roll is changed to a random creature within the normal range of the weapon
{@i The beam moves erratically.} Roll {@dice 1d4} and subtract it from the attack roll
{@i The beam grows dimmer.} If the attack hits, roll {@dice 1d6} and subtract it from the damage roll (to a minimum of 0)
{@i The beam glows green.} If the attack hits, the target gains {@dice 1d10} {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} (After taking the damage).
{@i The beam has a magnetic effect.} If the attack hits, the target is pushed {@dice 1d4} times 5 feet directly away from you
{@i The beam is extra strong.} If the attack hits, the target is pulled {@dice 1d4} times 5 feet directly towards you
{@i The beam slows down.} If the attack hits, the target doesn’t suffer any of its effects (including damage) until the start of your next turn

{@i The beam teleports repeatedly around the target.} If the attack hits, All creatures within a 15ft {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} of the target must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 1d10} Radiant damage on a fail

{@i The beam quickly pierces through multiple creatures.} If the attack hits, All creatures in a 90 foot {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line} from you in the direction of the target must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 1d10} Radiant damage on a fail
{@i The beam moves precisely.} Roll {@dice 1d4} and add it to the attack roll
{@i The beam glows brighter.} If the attack hits, it deals an additional {@dice 1d6} damage
{@i The beam becomes partially incorporeal.} The attack ignores all {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|cover} (Including Total Cover, allowing random targets to be selected through walls)
{@i The beam splits into a second beam.} If the attack hits, you immediately make another attack with the weapon against the same target

entries: {@note Inspired by Terraria, Made by Gem}

item.name: Greater Piwafwi
entries: This dark spider-silk cloak is made by drow. It is a cloak of elvenkind. It also grants resistance to fire damage while you wear it. It loses its magic if exposed to sunlight for 1 hour without interruption.
While you wear this cloak, Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks made to perceive you have Disadvantage, and you have Advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks.
{@note From Out of the Abyss, Ported by Aris}

item.name: Hellion Helm
entries: {@i A helmet fashioned in the likeness of a Fire Hellion, it carries an infernal warmth.}

Other creatures have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) and Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks made to discern your true identity or intentions. Additionally, you can add 1d4 to Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks.

entries.name: Infernal Searing.
entries: When you make an melee attack roll against a creature and hit it while wearing this helmet, the target takes an additional {@dice 1d4} Fire damage and can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} until the start of your next turn if it is damaged by this Fire damage.
{@note Made by Landon}

item.name: History's Reflection
entries: {@i The exact appearance of this item varies from item to item. Whether the case, it is an object that can read the imprints of time.}

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action while holding this item, you can cast {@spell Legend Lore|XPHB} from it. To cast the spell in this way, you choose a place of great history that you're currently in. The information about the place, provided it is of legendary importance, is displayed on or from the item as if history was being replayed, though it may be abstract or symbolic. If the place is not of legendary importance, then the spell fails.
Once used, the item cannot use that area again for 1 year.
{@note Variant of Lorekeeper's Tome by Aris. Made by Landon}

item.name: Inquisitor's Notebook
entries: While holding this notebook, you can cast {@spell Legend Lore|XPHB} from it. To cast the spell in this way, you must choose a creature that you can see within 10 feet of you. The information about that creature, provided it is of legendary importance, appears written in the pages of the notebook.
Once used, the notebook cannot use that creature again for 1 year.
{@note Variant of Lorekeeper's Tome by Aris. Made by Landon}

item.name: Megaton
item.reqAttune: by a Path of the Giant Barbarian
entries: A maul of colossal proportion, like an entire planet held aloft by a metal rod. Its rectangular hammerhead is segmented by lines of thrumming energy, indicating the advanced technology lurking within it.

entries.name: Colossus Circuit.
entries: Whenever you enter your Rage, if your size increases from either your Giant's Havoc or Demiurgic Colossus feature, this weapon increases in size alongside you and gains the following benefits for the duration of the Rage:

items: {@b Weight of the World.} When you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 1d6} damage of the same type as its normal damage. This extra damage is increased to {@dice 2d6} if the hit creature is smaller than you.

{@b Atom Smash.} As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can attempt to deal a skull-shattering blow. Make a melee weapon attack using Megaton against a creature that is smaller than you within range. On a hit, they suffer the normal effects of the attack and additionally must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + your Strength modifier + your Proficiency Bonus). On a fail, it is {@condition Slowed|WM4} until the end of your next turn. Once used, this item can't be used again in this way until the next dawn.

entries: {@note Made by Christopher}

item.name: Merrenoloth’s Oar
entries: {@i Made of special wood that grows only in the Lower Planes, this long oar is carved with ancient symbols of death from countless cultures.}

While you hold the oar, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Dexterity checks to maintain your balance while on a watercraft. In addition, as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} while you hold the oar, you can learn the depth of any water or liquid within sight, and the distance and direction to the closest land while you are on open water.

The merrenoloth’s oar can be used as a weapon. It is treated as a +1 {@item Lance|XPHB} when so wielded, and it can be used one-handed while you are on board any watercraft. It deals Fire damage instead of Piercing.
{@note Adapted from Dragon+ by Aris}

item.name: Mystery Potion (Rare)
entries: {@i Typically made as a byproduct by alchemists, this potion is fully unpredictable. Swirling this liquid causes its color to change rapidly between a variety of vibrant colors. Its smell is purely alchemical, providing no insight as to what could be inside.}
When you drink this potion, roll on the table below, gaining the effects of drinking or applying the rolled potion.

A creature can spend 1 hour studying the potion to attempt to identify and stabilize its effects. After the hour is done, the creature must make a DC 20 Intelligence ({@item Alchemist's Supplies|XPHB}) check. On a pass, roll on the table transforming the Mystery Potion into the rolled potion.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Nalfeshnee's Visage
entries: A mask of a Nalfeshnee, it holds remnants of its hideous power.

Other creatures have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) and Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks made to discern your true identity or intentions. Additionally, you can add {@dice 1d4} to Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) checks.

entries.name: Pursuit
entries: Immediately after you hit an enemy with an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB}, you can move up to half your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} as part of that Reaction.

entries.name: Horror Nimbus
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can create a 15-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you. Each creature within that {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} makes a Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 15. {@i Failure:} A target takes {@dice 8d6} Psychic damage, and the target has the {@condition Frightened} condition for 1 minute, until it takes damage, or until it ends its turn with you out of line of sight. {@i Success:} The target is unaffected. This item cannot be used this way again until next dawn.
{@note Made by Landon}

item.name: Nos Erac Ekat
entries: A paintbrush fashioned from a crooked bone, with frayed brushhairs grasping out like fingers. It fits in your hand perfectly.

entries.name: Vivid Paints.
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with your {@item Psychic Blade|XPHB|Psychic Blades}.

entries.name: Violet Bloom.
entries: You have a mental palette of red and blue that you can splash across your masterworks. Whenever you manifest a {@item Psychic Blade|XPHB|Psychic Blades}, you can change its damage type to Cold or Fire damage.

entries.name: Vantablack.
entries: While holding Nos Erac Ekat, you can cast {@spell Creation|XPHB}, as you paint the object from pure black. Once used, this item can't be used again in this way until the next dawn.
{@note Made by Christopher}

item.name: Pipe of Grief
entries: This long smoking pipe brings sorrowful memories when smoked.

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action while the pipe is filled with tobacco and lit, you can release a puff of magical smoke that takes the form of a 5 foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} centered on you. The cloud remains for {@dice 3d8} minutes, or until a strong wind disperses it. A creature that ends its turn in the cloud must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature is filled with grief, and has disadvantage on {@variantrule D20 test|XPHB|D20 tests} for 1 minute. A grieved creature can repeat the saving throw if it ends its turn outside of the cloud. After three successful saving throws, the grief effect ends.

Creatures immune to the {@condition Poisoned} condition are immune to this effect, as well as creatures that don't need to breathe. Once used, a magical cloud cannot be produced from this pipe again until the next dawn.
{@note From Book of Vile Darkness (3.5e). Made by Aris}

item.name: Potent Pressure Capsule
entries: This small capsule is made of beeswax blended with sand and a variety of enchanted water plants. A creature who consumes a pressure capsule ignores the effects of swimming at depths greater than 100 feet. This effect only ends when the creature dies or is targeted with {@spell Dispel Magic|XPHB} or a similar effect.
{@note Made by Ellie}

item.name: Potion of Poison Immunity
entries: When you drink this potion, you have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Poison damage and the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition for 1 hour.
This potion looks like a golden-hued liquid, and glows faintly in darkness.
{@note Made by Gavin}

item.name: Ring of Gnomekind
entries: {@i Legends hold that Garl Glittergold himself handed down these simple rings to his children (He didn't).}

entries.name: Gnome.
entries: The Ring of Gnomekind transforms you into an average looking gnome of average height and weight. The ring chooses the physical characteristics of the form, such as age, gender, skin color, hair color, and voice. Except for size, your statistics and species traits don't change, nor do items worn or carried by you.

entries.name: Gnomish.
entries: You know Gnomish

entries.name: Gnomish Cunning.
entries: Your Intelligence score increases by 2, to a maximum of 20. You have a +2 bonus to Dexterity ({@item Tinker's Tools|XPHB}) checks, and a +1 bonus to your spell save DCs for your Illusion spells.

entries.name: Friend of Gnomekind.
entries: You have Advantage on Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) checks made to interact with gnomes and svirfneblin.

entries.name: Gnomish Darkvision.
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision} with a range of 60 feet.
{@note Made by Chrys}

item.name: Ring of Mystery Keys
entries: This key ring always has many {@item Mystery Key|XDMG|Mystery Keys} on it. Inserting a key from the key ring into a lock has a 5 percent chance of unlocking it. If the first inserted key doesn't unlock the lock, none of the keys on the ring can. Once the key ring has unlocked a lock, it cannot unlock another lock for {@dice 1d4} hours.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Skin of Adhesion
entries: While wearing this tar-covered armor, you have a +1 bonus to your AC. When you attune to this, it melds into your skin, making you naturally excrete a sticky tar. You still retain the benefits of wearing the armor. While attuned, you gain the following benefits:

When you are hit with a Melee Attack with a weapon, you can take a Reaction to force the wielder of the weapon to make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the weapon becomes attached to your skin until you die or release it with a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. A creature can take an Action to pry the weapon off by succeeding on a DC 15 Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check. Once you use this feature 3 times, you cannot do so again until the next dawn.
{@note Made by Chrys}

item.name: Step Two
entries: One vial of this oil can cover a Medium or smaller creature, along with the equipment it's wearing and carrying (one additional vial is required for each size category above Medium). Applying the oil takes 10 minutes. The affected creature gains the following benefits for 8 hours.
The affected creature has a fly speed equal to its walking speed while it is under rainfall.
The affected creature is buoyant while underwater, rising 30 feet toward the surface at the start of each of its turns.
{@note Made by V}

item.name: Swarm Slayer
entries: {@i The following is engraved in Elvish into the side of the weapon: "When faced with one spider, one bullet will do. When faced with a hundred spiders, you're gonna need a hundred bullets."}

The Swarm Slayer is a Martial weapon that deals {@dice 5d4} Piercing damage on a hit and has the following properties: Ammunition (Range 20/120 ft.; Firearm Bullet), Loading, Heavy, Two-Handed, Mastery: Graze. Every time you make an attack with the Swarm Slayer, it expends 9 Firearm Bullets in addition to the ammunition loaded.

{@b Spray.} When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action, you can replace an attack with this weapon with spraying aimlessly in front of you. Each creature in a 30-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone} must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 5d6} Piercing damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you spend one minute to load 100 Firearm Bullets into the weapon.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: The Painting of Mara Jay
entries: This painting is an 8 foot long landscape of an open field near Raven's Bluff. A small town can be seen on the horizon line, and bison are grazing the grasses. The painting is signed by prodigy artist Mara Jay.
While The Painting of Mara Jay is placed in a bastion facility, it gains the following benefit:

entries.name: Inspired.
entries: Taking a bastion turn in the facility where the painting resides grants you a +{@dice 1d4} bonus to any {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests} within the facility.
You can only move the painting once per week, at the start of the new bastion turn.
{@note Made by Gavin}

item.name: Tobor
entries: This {@item Chest of Preserving|WDMM} has been outfitted with wheels and magic-induced locomotion, allowing it to act as a delivery unit for whatever it contains.

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} Action while within 15 feet of it, you can verbally command it to travel to a location you are familiar with or to stop traveling (if it is already en route). The location must be within 1 mile of its current location, unmoving, and on the same plane of existence. The target location must be clearly described, and effects that block divination magic block its pathfinding.

It has a movement speed of 15 feet per turn and is blocked by {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}, objects, creatures, and vertical drops. If for some awful reason it enters {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, it takes its movement at the end of the round, but does not have a turn of its own (as it is not a creature).
If it cannot find a path to its location after it has begun to travel, it will stop moving and wait until a feasible path exists.
It's unclear why it's called a Tobor.
{@note Made by Christopher}

item.name: Tome of Language Imparted
entries: After reading this scroll, book, or tome (typically takes an hour, but a GM could rule it takes days or even weeks), you are magically imparted a language. You gain that language, and can speak it at a natural level. The language is obscure. It cannot be any of the standard or exotic languages in the phb, nor can it be Druidic or Thieves' Cant.
Once a language has been magically imparted, the tome becomes nonmagical, though it might contain nonmagical lessons in the language.
Examples of adequate languages: Ice Toad, Gnoll, Giant Eagle, Chondathan, Worg...

It is said that the final ingredient of crafting this item is fluency in a language. A creature fluent in a language gives up the language in its entirety, to be passed on to another. The language cannot be learned by that creature again.
{@note Made by Aris}

item.name: Tome of Mystra's Cataclysmic Destruction
entries: This weathered tome of history bound by auspicious prayer seals to various gods is only but a long-gone shadow of its formerly powerful self, dyed and dissected by mortal desire. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} while holding the tome you may choose the following magical effects to occur, causing the book to disintegrate into nothingness immediately afterwards.
{@b Detect Outsiders.} You gain the benefit of the {@reward Tracker's Sense|WM4} Talent against Aberrations for the next hour.
{@note Made by Denny}

item.name: Unquenchable Heart
entries: {@i The modified core of a mighty machine, now yours. When inside your chest, you can feel it burn with conviction.}

entries.name: Integrated.
entries: While you live, this item can't be removed from you against your will. However, once installed, it takes a Bastion Turn to safely unattune from it, as it is a very delicate process.

entries.name: Charged.
entries: The heart has 6 charges, and it regains all expended charges daily at dawn. You can spend these charges on the following:

items.name: Voice Circuit.
entries: You can expend 1 of the heart's charges to project your voice to be heard clearly by all creatures within 1 mile of yourself, regardless of intervening noise, for 1 minute. Magical silence, 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood blocks this projection.

items.name: Rapid Barrier Energization.
entries: At the start of your turn, if your Arcane Ward has 0 hit points, you can expend 3 of the heart's charges to have it regain a number of hit points equal to twice your Intelligence modifier.
{@note Loosely inspired by Draedon's Heart from the Terraria Calamity mod. Voice Circuit taken and modified from Ring of the Orator. Made by Christopher}

item.name: Unseen Fog
entries: This small canister contains thick and obscuring fog, enchanted to be invisible. You can use a Utilize action to activate it, at which point the item casts {@spell Fog Cloud|XPHB} (no Concentration required) centered on itself. This fog has no effect on any creature that does not have {@sense Truesight|XPHB}, as it cannot see it.
Once used, this item cannot be used again until the next dawn.
{@note Made by V}

item.name: Voidwalker Armor (Variant)
entries: This black studded leather armor bears a red sheen. While wearing this armor, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to summon a projection of yourself in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of yourself. The projection is a translucent copy of you that has Immunity to all damage and conditions, and you can make attacks and cast spells with a range other than self as if standing in the projection’s space. The projection disappears at the end of your turn. Once you use this {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, it can’t be used again until the next dawn.

{@b Curse.} This armor is cursed, and attuning to it extends the curse to you. As long as you remain cursed, you’re unwilling to part with the armor. Taking it off fails to end the curse. While cursed in this way, you feel disconnected from your body, continuously hearing whispers that call for you to join them. Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} while cursed, you must make a DC 11 Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, you gain no benefit from that {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} and your Charisma score decreases by 2. You die if this reduces that score to 0.
{@note From the Book of Many Things}

item.name: +3 Anklet of Nature's Passage
entries: While wearing this magic item, you gain a +3 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your Ranger spells.
While you wear this anklet, your walking speed is increased by 10 feet.

item.name: +3 Bracelet of Nature's Will
entries: While wearing this magic item, you gain +3 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your Druid spells.
While you wear this bracelet, you can use your Wild Shape feature without expending one of the feature's uses. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: +3 Fortune Clover
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to the saving throw DCs of your Rogue features and your Weapon Masteries.
When you hit with an attack roll, if you haven't used the Sneak Attack feature this turn, you can apply your Sneak Attack. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: +3 Medal of Valor
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to the saving throw DCs of your Fighter features and your Weapon Masteries.
When you use your Action Surge feature, you have Advantage on your next Attack roll before the end of your next turn.

item.name: +3 Rhythm-Maker's Instrument
entries: As an Action, you can touch the item and transform it into any type of instrument of your choice.
While holding this instrument, you gain a +3 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your Bard spells.
As an Action, you can play this instrument to regain one use of your Bardic Inspiration feature. This property of the instrument can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: +3 Vital Bandages
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to the saving throw DCs of your Barbarian features and your Weapon Masteries.
While you wear these bandages, you can use your Rage feature without expending one of the feature's uses. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Acorn of the Ice Squirrel
entries: This acorn is imbued with the diabolical power of ice. It can grant you great power, at a price.

entries.name: Diabolical Resistance.
entries: You are Immune to Cold damage and Resistant to Fire and Poison

entries.name: Curse.
entries: This item is cursed. While attuned, you take a -2 penalty to Dexterity Skill Checks and Saving Throws. You can't voluntarily end your attunement to it. If you're targeted by a spell that ends a curse, your attunement to the acorn ends.
{@note Made by Andrew}

item.name: Cloak of the Frenzied Lord
entries: While attuned to this mantle, you have Resistance to Psychic damage and your melee Weapon Attacks deal an additional {@dice 1d6} Psychic damage.

entries.name: Wave of Madness
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you unleash a pulse of befuddlement and paranoia. Each creature within a 20-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} centered on you must make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, they are {@condition Confused|WM4} for the next minute. An affected creature can repeat the save at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on a success. Once you use this feature you cannot do so again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Expand Potential
entries: You tap into the powers present within the Far Realm. When you use this feature, you take {@dice 6d6} Psychic damage and cast one of the following spells on yourself without taking a {@action Magic|XPHB} action:
{@spell Blur|XPHB}, {@spell Mirror Image|XPHB}, {@spell Haste|XPHB}, {@spell Stoneskin|XPHB}

When you cast them this way, your Wisdom score is reduced by the spell’s level. If your Wisdom score is reduced to 0 this way, you die. When you are targeted with {@spell Greater Restoration|XPHB} only restores two points of Wisdom rather than the entire reduction. {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB|Long Rests} do not restore reduced Wisdom score from this item.
{@note Made by Chrys}

item.name: Eternal Sending Stone
entries: Eternal Sending Stones come in pairs, with each stone carved to match the other so the pairing is easily recognized. While you touch one stone, you can cast {@spell Sending|XPHB} from it. The target is the bearer of the other stone. If no creature bears the other stone, you know that fact as soon as you use the stone, and you don't cast the spell.
If one of the stones in a pair is destroyed, the other one becomes nonmagical.
{@note Made by Aris}

item.name: Humming Anamnesis
entries: While held, this peculiar dodecahedron emits hums and clicks of an alien language.

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can activate the Anamnesis and gain a +10 bonus to {@action Study|XPHB} actions you make for the next minute. After activation, the hums and clicks of the Anamnesis crescendo and invade your senses, as if trying to communicate with you; when you take the {@action Search|XPHB} action or make a Wisdom saving throw, you subtract {@dice 1d6} from the roll. This penalty remains until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. The Humming Anamnesis cannot be used again until the next dawn.
{@note Made by Chrys}

item.name: Mystery Potion (Very Rare)
entries: {@i Typically made as a byproduct by alchemists, this potion is fully unpredictable. Swirling this liquid causes its color to change rapidly between a variety of vibrant colors. Its smell is purely alchemical, providing no insight as to what could be inside.}
When you drink this potion, roll on the table below, gaining the effects of drinking or applying the rolled potion.

A creature can spend 1 hour studying the potion to attempt to identify and stabilize its effects. After the hour is done, the creature must make a DC 25 Intelligence ({@item Alchemist's Supplies|XPHB}) check. On a pass, roll on the table transforming the Mystery Potion into the rolled potion.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Pocket Organ
entries: {@i Thousands of pipes shrunk to fit into your pocket.}

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can place this 1-foot pipe on the ground and using a command cause it to grow into a large pipe organ. Repeating the command word causes the organ to revert to a pipe. Each creature in the area where the organ appears is pushed to an unoccupied space outside but next to the organ. Objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried are also pushed clear of the organ.

The organ is 15ft wide, 5ft thick, and 30ft tall. At the base of the organ rests manuals and a pedalboard that are used to play the organ. Magic prevents the tower from being tipped over. The organ has an AC of 20; HP 100; {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage except that which is dealt by siege equipment; and {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to all other damage. Only a {@spell Wish|XPHB} spell can repair the tower (this use of the spell counts as replicating a spell of level 8 or lower). Each casting of {@spell Wish|XPHB} causes the tower to regain all its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. If the organ is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, it reverts into a pipe and cannot be grown until repaired.

When played, the organ can be heard up to half a mile away. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can pull out all the stops and begin to play incredibly loud requiring {@status Concentration|XPHB}. The music fills a 60-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} origination from the organ. Whenever a creature enters the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} or ends its turn there, the creature must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@dice 5d6} Thunder damage and has the {@condition Deafened|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn. Creatures that are {@condition Deafened|XPHB} automatically pass the saving throw.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Staff of Pestilence
item.reqAttune: by a Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, or Wizard
entries: {@i This wooden staff is covered in diseased sores that ooze yellow pus. It gives off a horrible odor of rotten flesh}
You have Immunity to the effects of Poisons and non-magical diseases while you hold this staff.
The staff has 10 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC:

items: {@spell Infestation|XGE} (0 charges)
{@spell Allergy Field|WM4} (5th-level version, targets air instead of plants; 1 charge)
{@spell Befoul|WM4} (6 charges)
{@spell Blindness/Deafness|XPHB} (5th-level version; 1 charge)
{@spell Contagion|XPHB} (3 charges)
{@spell Harm|XPHB} (3 charges)
{@spell Insect Plague|XPHB} (2 charges)
{@spell Pox|WM4} (1 charge)
{@spell Ray of Sickness|XPHB} (5th-level version; 1 charge)

entries: The staff regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, you are inflicted with Flesh Rot until cured, as the staff rots away into a puddle of diseased pus.
{@note Made by Aris}

item.name: Sun Pellet
entries: This small ceramic ball is specially coated with enchanted oil. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can crack a sun pellet or throw it up to 100 feet, whereupon it releases a brilliant magical light. This light is equivalent to a {@spell Sunburst|XPHB} spell (save DC 15) but has a radius of 20 feet.
{@note From Dragon+, Made by Aris}

item.name: Tol-kendar
entries: The Tol-kendar (“body wrecker” in Infernal) is a magic weapon that grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. Wielded by the asymmetrical yagnoloths, it takes the form of a 10-foot-long steel Pike topped by a metal cup ringed with blades, with a harpoon point emerging from the cup’s center. The Tol-kendar has the statistics of a {@item Pike|XPHB}, but each time you hit, you can choose to do either Piercing damage with the harpoon or Slashing damage with the blades.

When you roll a 20 on an attack roll made with the Tol-kendar, the weapon pierces deep into the target’s body to deal an extra {@dice 2d8} Piercing damage. A target that isn’t a Construct or Undead must then succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be {@condition Stunned} until the start of your next turn.
{@note Adapted from Dragon+ by Aris}

item.name: Worn Card: 0 - The Fool
entries: {@i 'Where journey begins.'}

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you may brandish this card to cast {@spell Word of Recall|XPHB} without any components. If you do not have a designated sanctuary, the spell fails and the card is not consumed. Once you use the card, it disintegrates into dust.

item.name: Worn Card: I - The Magician
entries: {@i 'May you never miss your goal.'}
As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action or Bonus Action, you may brandish this card to gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls for 1 minute. Once you use the card, it disintegrates into dust.

item.name: Worn Card: II - The High Priestess
entries: {@i 'Mother is watching you.'}

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action or Bonus Action, you may brandish this card to summon a Gargantuan-sized, heeled, and disembodied leg to stomp a point you choose, creating a 10-foot-radius, 30-foot-high Cylinder extending upwards from that point. Any creatures within this space must make a DC 18 Dexterity Saving Throw or take {@dice 12d6} Bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition Prone}. Creatures that save take half damage and are not knocked {@condition Prone}. Once this resolves, the leg rises up and disappears, and the card disintegrates into dust.

item.name: Worn Card: V - The Hierophant
entries: {@i 'Two prayers for the lost.'}
As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action or Bonus Action, you may brandish this card to gain 10 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}. Once you use the card, it disintegrates into dust.

item.name: Worn Card: V - The Hierophant?
entries: {@i 'Two prayers for the lost.'}

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action or Bonus Action, you may brandish this card to gain 5 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}. When these {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} are reduced to 0, you may negate any additional damage dealt to yourself. Once you use the card, it disintegrates into dust.

item.name: Worn Card: VI - The Lovers
entries: {@i 'May you prosper and be in good health.'}

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action or Bonus Action, you may brandish this card to spend an amount of your {@variantrule Hit Point Die|XPHB} less than or equal to your proficiency bonus. For each {@variantrule Hit Point Die|XPHB} you spend in this way, roll the die and add your Constitution modifier to it. You regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the total (minimum of 1 Hit Point). Once you use the card, it disintegrates into dust.

item.name: Worn Card: VII - The Chariot
entries: {@i 'May nothing stand before you.'}
As an Action or Bonus Action, you may brandish this card to gain the following effects until the end of your next turn:

items: Your movement speed becomes 60 feet.
You cannot cast spells, {@status concentration|XPHB|Concentrate} on spells, or make ranged attacks.
The first melee attack you hit as part of an Attack action deals an extra 1d8 damage of the weapon's damage type.

entries: Once you use the card, it disintegrates into dust.

item.name: Censer of Blood
entries: This brass incense burner hangs on a brass chain, and is covered with fiendish symbols and the names of ancient vampires. While the censer is on your person, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to track by scent and Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks to detect smells. In addition, you are aware of the exact location of any creature within 60 feet of you that is below its hit point maximum.

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can spill one drop or more of your own blood into the censer, causing it to steam. You suffer one level of {@condition Exhaustion}, and the censer issues forth {@dice 1d6} {@creature Vampiric Mist|MTF|vampiric mists} that appear within 10 feet of you. You can repeat this process to create multiple mists, taking yourself to a maximum of five levels of {@condition Exhaustion}. You can have no more than 50 {@creature Vampiric Mist|MTF|vampiric mists} created at a time with this item. The {@creature Vampiric Mist|MTF|vampiric mists} don’t appear if you are in sunlight.

The summoned {@creature Vampiric Mist|MTF|vampiric mists} understand your language and obey your spoken commands. If you issue no commands, they attack all nearby humanoids except yourself, only sparing those that you specifically command them to.

You reduce levels of {@condition Exhaustion} imposed by the censer of blood in the normal fashion. Each mist lasts until it is destroyed, until you die, or until you dismiss it as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.
{@note Adapted from Dragon+ by Aris}

item.name: Cheese With Everything
entries: {@i “Everything?”}

This pizza carries with it extra cheese, the wonders of the earth, and the beauty of the stars. As part of a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you may eat this pie. The pie sates you for time immemorial. You no longer need to eat.
{@note Made by Miel}

item.name: Handkerchief of Darkness
entries: This black velvet handkerchief is inscribed with a repeating pattern of closed eyes. The handkerchief normally appears to be the size of a napkin, but it can be unfolded to the size of a tablecloth.

When the handkerchief is folded to the size of a napkin, you can drop or throw it as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, creating an area of magical darkness around the handkerchief identical to that created by a {@spell Darkness|XPHB} spell. The {@spell Darkness|XPHB} endures until the handkerchief is picked up by a creature.

When the handkerchief is unfolded to the size of a tablecloth, you can throw it as an action to have it magically fly high in the air. The handkerchief hovers 50 feet above you and a shadowy fog billows out of it, filling a cylinder 100 feet high and 1,000 feet across, with the handkerchief at its center. The area of the fog is {@variantrule lightly obscured|XPHB}, and creatures that suffer negative effects while in sunlight ignore those effects while within the fog. The fog lasts until the handkerchief is picked up by a creature (typically one that can fly).
{@note Adapted from Dragon+ by Aris}

item.name: Helm of the Slumbering Lord
entries: While attuned to this helm, your attack rolls and saving throws only suffer a -1 penalty per level of {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB}, you do not need to sleep, and are {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB|Immune} to the {@condition Asleep|WM4} condition.

As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you may gain a level of {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} and inflict the following effects on any number of creatures you can see within a 20-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}, based on how many levels of {@condition Exhaustion} you have. These effects resolve before you gain the level of {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB}. Any levels of {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} gained in this way can be reduced by finishing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} or being revived from death, and cannot be removed in any other way.
1+ levels of Exhaustion: The target must make a DC 17 Intelligence saving throw, taking {@dice 2d6} Psychic damage per level of {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} you have, halved on a success.
2+ levels of Exhaustion: The target must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls and saving throws until the end of your next turn.
3+ levels of Exhaustion: The target must succeed on a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or have the {@condition Immobilized|WM4} condition until the end of its next turn.

4+ levels of Exhaustion: The target must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Asleep|WM4} condition for 1 minute. While {@condition Asleep|WM4}, the target cannot be woken up by taking damage. At the end of each of its turns, it can repeat the save, ending the condition on a success.
5+ levels of Exhaustion: The target must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, gaining 2 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} levels on a failure, or 1 on a success.

6 levels of Exhaustion: If the target has the {@condition Asleep|WM4} condition and has less than 250 Hit Points, it must succeed on a DC 17 Charisma saving throw or be killed instantly. Otherwise, it takes {@dice 20d10} Psychic damage.
{@note Made by Ellie}

item.name: Mystery Potion (Legendary)
entries: {@i Typically made as a byproduct by alchemists, this potion is fully unpredictable. Swirling this liquid causes its color to change rapidly between a variety of vibrant colors. Its smell is purely alchemical, providing no insight as to what could be inside.}
When you drink this potion, roll on the table below, gaining the effects of drinking or applying the rolled potion.

A creature can spend 1 hour studying the potion to attempt to identify and stabilize its effects. After the hour is done, the creature must make a DC 30 Intelligence ({@item Alchemist's Supplies|XPHB}) check. On a pass, roll on the table transforming the Mystery Potion into the rolled potion.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Octavo of Keeping
entries: In the arcanaloths’ endless quest for knowledge and power, no magic item is as highly sought after as the Books of Keeping, in which the true names of all yugoloths are scribed. Over eons of research, a few arcanaloths have managed to record the true names of some of their weaker kin in smaller tomes, creating tiny versions of the Books of Keeping for their own purposes. Each octavo of keeping contains the names of 1d4 + 1 yugoloths, as well as ritual instructions for summoning them written in a complex code combining Infernal and Abyssal. These special instructions are unique to each yugoloth. For each name in an octavo, roll a d6 to determine what kind of yugoloth it is:

A creature that can read both Infernal and Abyssal must succeed on a DC 15 Intelligence {{@skill Arcana}) check to decode each ritual in the Octavo of Keeping. Any creature that decodes a ritual can use the octavo thereafter to summon the yugoloth named by the ritual. This requires 1 hour, rare incense and alchemical powders worth 5,000 gp, and the blood sacrifice of a creature of at least Medium size. When the ritual is completed, the yugoloth appears from the Lower Planes and the summoner must make an Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check contested by the yugoloth’s Intelligence check. If the sacrificed creature was a humanoid of Intelligence 4 or greater, the summoner has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the check.

If the yugoloth wins the opposed check, the ritual was performed improperly and the fiend is free to act as it wishes. This typically involves attempting to kill the summoner and destroy the octavo (see below). If the summoner wins or ties the check, the yugoloth cannot attack or cast spells on the summoner (though any other creatures in the area are fair game) and is bound to obey the summoner for 24 hours. However, the yugoloth always bends and misinterprets the summoner’s commands if it can, and the DM might call for Charisma checks to threaten, coax, or trick the yugoloth into doing exactly what the summoner wants. After 24 hours, the yugoloth vanishes back to Gehenna.

If an octavo of keeping is used multiple times, the same yugoloths are summoned again and again, even if they were previously destroyed. This greatly annoys the affected yugoloths, which constantly scheme for revenge. If a summoned yugoloth can get its hands on the octavo, it can tear the book in half as an action, destroying it and summoning all the yugoloths whose names are written in the book. Those fiends appear at the start of the yugoloth’s next turn, work together to kill the summoner and its allies, then go on a rampage of murder and destruction before returning to Gehenna 24 hours later.
{@note Adapted from Dragon+ by Aris}

item.name: Soda of Devastation
entries: {@i soda pop}
As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can shake the soda. Everytime you shake it, there is a percent chance equal to the times its been shaken that it explodes.
When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action, you can replace an attack with throwing the can up to 300 feet, where it instantly explodes.

When the can explodes, all creatures within a 5 foot radius must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw. The radius increases by 5 feet every time it is shaken. On a failure it takes {@dice 1d10} Force damage per time the can was shaken, or half as much on a success.
A nonmagical object that isn't being worn or carried also takes the damage if it's in the area.
Every day at dawn, the can settles down, resetting as if it had not been shaken.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Ultroloth’s Eye
entries: Resembling a large, pale fire opal, this gem is actually a magically preserved eye from an ultroloth—one of the yugoloths’ secretive lords.

When you hold the ultroloth’s eye up to one of your own eyes and look through it, you feel terrible pain, and you take {@dice 1d6} Poison damage and {@dice 1d6} Acid damage at the end of each of your turns in which you look through the eye. While looking through the eye, you are colorblind but have {@sense Truesight} out to a range of 120 feet.
{@b Fiendish Insight.} You also gain an additional benefit based on which eye you hold the ultroloth’s eye up to. (If you have more than two eyes, the DM rolls randomly to determine the effect.)

If the ultroloth’s eye is held to your left eye, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to look at a creature of Intelligence 4 or greater. While doing so, you learn the name and appearance of the mortal being that creature most loves and respects. If the ultroloth’s eye is held to your right eye, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to look at a creature of Intelligence 4 or greater. While doing so, you learn the thing that creature most fears.
If a creature you look at with either of these features has telepathy, it is aware of what you’re doing and can shield itself from your scrutiny with a successful DC 17 Wisdom saving throw.

{@b Permanent Placement.} While attuned to the ultroloth’s eye, you can gouge out your own eye and press the gem into the empty socket. You take {@dice 6d6} Acid damage and {@dice 6d6} Poison damage by doing so, but if you survive, the eye grafts itself into your head. A grafted eye gives you the permanent benefit of its features (depending on which eye socket it replaces) and does not deal damage when you use it. It no longer counts against the number of magic items you can attune to, and remains a part of you until you die.
{@note Adapted from Dragon+ by Aris}

item.name: Bag of Rats
entries: {@i "Only a fool would open this bag" - Elminster}

{@i Sewn from the flesh of Sneel, former deity of rats, this bag is constantly thrashing. The inside of the bag has never been seen, but some say it is a portal to the Black Sewers, where Raxivort spends his days making rats from pure chaos.}
The Bag of Rats has an AC of 11, and 100 hit points. On Initiative 0, the Bag of Rats repairs itself, regaining all of its hit points.

entries.name: Interplanar Nature.
entries: The Bag of Rats is unable to enter any space that prevents interplanar travel. If the Bag of Rats is in an area and a {@spell Gate Seal|SatO} or similar magic is cast on its space, it is summoned to the nearest place on the same plane that isn't protected from interplanar travel. If no such space exists on the current plane, the Bag of Rats is immediately summoned to a random plane of existence.

entries.name: Pack Nature.
entries: All {@creature rat|XMM|Rats} and {@creature swarm of rats|XMM|Swarms of Rats} are friendly to all other {@creature rat|XMM|Rats} and have no allegiance to a creature that lets them out of the bag, often being hostile to it.

entries.name: Quick Grab.
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action you reach into the bag, taking {@dice 1d4-2} (min 0) Piercing damage from being bit, to summon a {@creature Rat|XMM} in your hand. As part of the action you can throw the {@creature rat|XMM} up to 60 feet.

entries.name: Deploy Rodents.
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action you can attempt to quickly open and close the bag, launching out a {@creature swarm of rats|XMM} at a point you can see within 30 feet. A {@creature Swarm of Rats|XMM} is summoned from the bag at the point. Additionally make a DC 15 Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check. On a failure, you cannot close the bag. Every turn the bag is open, a {@creature Swarm of Rats|XMM} is summoned at the entrance of the bag. A creature can make a DC 15 {@skill Athletics} check to attempt to close the bag.

entries.name: Swarm Breach.
entries: If the bag remains open for 1 minute or has 0 hit points, it ruptures exploding into a 5-foot-diameter portal. The portal functions as a permanent {@spell gate|XPHB} spell. One per round on initiative count 20, the portal summons a {@creature Swarm of Rats|XMM}. The Bag of Rats reforms {@dice 4d10} days after it ruptures, turning a random {@creature Swarm of Rats|XMM} on any plane into a new bag, ending the {@spell gate|XPHB}.

entries.name: Destroying the Bag.
entries: The bag of rats can only be destroyed if Raxivort is killed while the Swarm Breach gate is open, or a creature holds the bag shut for 5 years.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Egg of Lolth
entries: {@i The egg of Lolth is a potent artifact with a long history. Originally nothing more than a cursed item that compelled its wielder to fling himself through a gate to the Abyss, its long exposure to the chaotic energies of the Demonweb Pits has transformed it into the deadly device it is today.}
This artifact functions as a Material component for the purpose of casting {@spell Plane Shift|XPHB}, but only if the destination is the Demonweb Pits.
While inactive, the artifact appears to be a smooth, fist sized platinum egg. When touched, it vibrates slightly, and faint sounds of scratching can be heard coming from within.

To activate this item, a casting of Remove Curse on it is required. When done so, it turns into a shuddering, tumescent bag of spider silk. On the following round, the bag tears itself open, summoning 5 {@creature Swarm of Insects|XMM|Swarms of Spiders} ({@creature Swarm of Insects|XMM} with the Fiend type, MM'25) and 1 {@creature Darkweaver|MPP} (with the Fiend type). Then, for the next minute, during each round, 1 {@creature Giant Spider|XMM} (with the Fiend type) is summoned by the egg. After which, the artifact reverts to inactivity and cannot be activated again until the next Midnight.

Creatures summoned by the egg appear in an unoccupied space on the ground within 10 feet of the egg and are {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} to non-drow creatures. After 10 Minutes, all spiders summoned by the egg are cast back into the Abyss.
While the artifact is activated, any creature that touches it is automatically transported to the Demonweb Pits.
Every time the artifact goes inactive, roll {@dice 1d20}. On a 1, it is instantly teleported to a location in the Demonweb Pits or the Material Plane of Lolth's choosing.

entries.name: Destroying the Artifact
entries: The egg has to be embraced by Corellon as one of his own and is destroyed.
{@note Made by Chrys}

item.name: Mystery Potion (Artifact)
entries: {@i Mystra help you. This potion was made by the world's greatest alchemist when she accidentally inverted her bag of holding full of supplies into Iggwilv's Cauldron. The resulting concoction was bottled many times and transported across the realms.}
When you drink this you gain the effects of every potion on the {@item Mystery Potion (Legendary)|WM4} table (ignoring roll again).

entries.name: Destroying the Potion.
entries: The potion can only be destroyed by being drunk by a creature, where it immediately becomes an empty bottle.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Family Fortune
entries: The fortune is a treasure worth 100gp. A creature attuned to the fortune can take a Magic action to magically "sell" the treasure, converting it into a pile of gold coins equal to its value, destroying the fortune.

While attuned the fortune begins to increase in value. Every bastion turn, it increases in value by 50gp to a max value of 300gp. If a creature dies while attuned to the fortune, the treasure disappears and stops increasing in value. If the creature is brought back to life within 1 month, they immediately reattune to the fortune and the fortune reappears in the space that it was left.

entries.name: Poor (Level 3).
entries: The fortune now increases by 100gp per bastion turn, to a max of 600gp

entries.name: Livable (Level 5).
entries: The fortune now increases by 200gp per bastion turn, to a max of 1,000gp

entries.name: Alright (Level 8).
entries: The fortune now increases by 300gp per bastion turn, to a max of 3,000gp

entries.name: Comfortable (Level 11).
entries: The fortune now increases by 500gp per bastion turn, to a max of 5,000gp

entries.name: Wealthy (Level 15).
entries: The fortune now increases by 1,500gp per bastion turn, to a max of 15,000gp

entries.name: Rich (Level 17).
entries: The fortune now increases by 3,000gp per bastion turn, to a max of 30,000gp

entries.name: 1% (Level 20).
entries: The fortune now increases by 10,000gp per bastion turn, to a max of 50,000gp

entries.name: Cursed
entries: This fortune is cursed. Attuning to it curses you until you are targeted by a {@spell Remove Curse|XPHB} spell or similar magic. Whenever your attunement ends to the item, the fortune vanishes.

entries.name: Legacy Rituals.
entries: All of the abilities of the item are unlocked, requiring no rituals.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Heart of Gears
entries: {@i This large metal amalgamation of electrum gears empowers any construct it is installed into. The nature of the gears causes constructs to take on a more mechanical nature, allowing greater consistency in all that they do.}
When attuned to, the Heart of Gears is installed into the creature, disappearing and becoming one with it. When unattuned, the Heart of Gears reappears next to the creature.
Your movement speed is increased by 10 feet. You have advantage on saving throws against the {@condition Prone} condition.

entries.name: Engrained Talent (Level 5).
entries: The Heart of Gears holds mechanical knowledge on tools. When you finish a long or short rest, choose a tool that you aren't Proficient with. You gain Proficiency with that tool until the end of your next short or long rest. This feature starts unlocked.

entries.name: Clockwork Consistency (Level 7).
entries: The Heart of Gears gains the ability to give consistency to attacks you make. It has 4 charges and regains {@dice 1d4} charges daily at dawn. When you make an attack roll, you can expend a charge to forgo rolling the d20 to get a 10 on the die.

entries.name: Mechanical Nature (Level 9).
entries: The Heart of Gears learns to adapt to absorb attacks made against you. Any Critical Hit against you becomes a normal hit.

entries.name: All-Around Programming (Level 11).
entries: The Heart of Gears gains the ability to provide consistency in all that you do. You can use Clockwork Consistency on any D20 Test you make, not just attack rolls.

entries.name: Proper Oiling (Level 15).
entries: The Heart of Gears improves, having 6 charges instead of 4, regaining {@dice 1d4+2} charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Fine Tuned Machinery (Level 17).
entries: The Heart of Gears improves allowing consistency all of the time. It has 8 charges instead of 6, and regains all charges daily at dawn. When you roll initiative while the heart has no charges remaining, it regains {@dice 1d4+1} charges.

entries.name: Clockwork Mastery (Level 20).
entries: The Heart of Gears learns when it is needed. When you make a D20 test, you can use a reaction to expend a charge to replace the number you roll with a 10.

entries.name: Legacy Rituals.
entries: Three rituals are needed to unlock the abilities of the Heart of Gears.

items: {@b Advanced Parts:} You must defeat a Construct of CR 6 or higher, and spend an hour to incorporate its components into the heart. This unlocks the Level 7-9 features.

{@b Mechanus Machinery:} You must defeat a Modron of CR 10 or higher, and spend an hour to incorporate its components into the heart. Alternatively, you can incorporate 10k gp worth of parts bought from Mechanus. This unlocks the level 11-15 features.
{@b Inevitability:} You must defeat an Inevitable of CR 20 or higher, and spend an hour to incorporate its components into the heart. This unlocks the level 17-20 features.

entries: {@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Mystery Potion (Legacy)
entries: {@i Passed down from generations from one great alchemist to another. It's like a forever stew.}

This potion is filled with a Mystery Potion (Uncommon). Once drunk in this form, it instead is filled with {@item Mystery Potion (Common)|WM4}. When drunk as a {@item Mystery Potion (Common)|WM4}, the potion becomes empty, refilling as the highest unlocked rarity mystery potion at the next dawn.

entries.name: Crazy (Level 5).
entries: The potion starts filled with {@item Mystery Potion (Rare)|WM4}. When drunk in this form, it is refilled with {@item Mystery Potion (Uncommon)|WM4}.

entries.name: Crazier (Level 11).
entries: The potion starts filled with {@item Mystery Potion (Very Rare)|WM4}. When drunk in this form, it is refilled with {@item Mystery Potion (Rare)|WM4}.

entries.name: Craziest (Level 17).
entries: The potion starts filled with {@item Mystery Potion (Legendary)|WM4}. When drunk in this form, it is refilled with {@item Mystery Potion (Very Rare)|WM4}.

entries.name: Legacy Rituals.
entries: Three rituals are needed to unlock the abilities of the Mystery Potion (Legacy).

items: {@b A bit of this.} You must mix in the hair of a CR 5 or higher creature that is chaotically aligned. This unlocks the level 5 feature.
{@b Tad of that.} You must mix in the nail of a CR 11 or higher creature that is chaotically aligned. This unlocks the level 11 feature.
{@b And a drop of whatever.} You must mix in the blood of a CR 17 or higher creature that is chaotically aligned. This unlocks the level 17 feature.

entries: {@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Remembrance of the Vaati
item.reqAttune: by a creature of non-chaotic alignment
entries: {@i Most cannot recall the height of the Wind Duke’s empire. However, this circlet, over a millennia of age, remembers it well; both the empire’s gilded heights and its bloody fall during the war between Law and Chaos.}
While you are wearing and are attuned to the circlet, you gain the following benefits:
You can speak and understand Primordial (Auran). You can cast {@spell Gust|XGE}, {@spell Fog Cloud|XPHB}, and {@spell Dust Devil|XGE} from the circlet.
The spell save DC for spells attached to this item is equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence, Wisdom, or your Charisma modifier (You choose when you attune to this item).

entries.name: Wergadeam (Level 5)
entries: You take on an innate quality of the Wind Dukes. Your falls count as having fallen 60 less feet for the purposes of taking damage from falling (to a minimum of 0 feet).

entries.name: Trygrideam (Level 7).
entries: You recall the practices of the druidic sect of Wind Dukes that followed nature’s order. You can cast {@spell Druidcraft|XPHB} and {@spell Gust of Wind|XPHB} from the circlet. The circlet can't cast {@spell Gust of Wind|XPHB} again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Haikjadeam (Level 9).
entries: You recall the wrath of the Wind Dukes. When you hit with a weapon or spell attack, you deal an extra {@dice 1d6} Thunder damage. Against the following types of creatures, you instead deal {@dice 2d6} Thunder damage: Aberrations, Celestial Eladrin, Fey, and Demons.

entries.name: Kheirdeam (Level 11).
entries: You recall the counsels of the Wind Dukes. You can cast {@spell Spare the Dying|XPHB} and {@spell Calm Emotions|XPHB} from the circlet. The circlet can't cast {@spell Calm Emotions|XPHB} again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Bledrudeam (Level 15).
entries: Your mind is more resilient against the forces of chaos. You have Advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma Saving Throws on effects originating from the following types of creatures: Aberrations, Celestial Eladrin, Fey, and Demons.

entries.name: Wendeam (Level 17).
entries: You recall the powers the exiled sect Wind Dukes dedicated to tracking the agents of chaos. You can cast {@spell Lightning Lure|TCE} and {@spell Mind Spike|XPHB} from the circlet. The circlet can't cast {@spell Mind Spike|XPHB} again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Vindeam (Level 20).
entries: You take on more qualities of the Wind Dukes. You can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to give yourself a Flying speed equal to 60 feet for the next hour. Once you use this feature, you cannot do so for another {@dice 2d6} hours.

entries.name: Legacy Rituals.
entries: Three rituals are needed to unlock the abilities of the Remembrance of the Vaati.

items: {@b Law’s Vengeance:} You must defeat a Demon of CR 5 or higher and douse its corpse in {@item axiomatic water|WM4}. This unlocks the Level 7-9 features.
{@b Elemental Unity:} You must convince an Elemental of CR 6 or higher to swear fealty to you. This unlocks the level 11-15 features.
{@b Ancient Enemy:} You must defeat an avatar of either the Queen of Chaos or Miska the Wolf Spider. This unlocks the level 17-20 features.

entries: {@note Made by Chrys}

item.name: ɹǝlɓuoɹɥ⊥ ǝɥ⊥
entries: {@i A coalescence of power beyond this mortal realm, too luck upon this is invite madness upon yourself.}

While attuned to this item, you gain 1 long term madness. When you complete a long rest, you may attempt a DC 15 wisdom saving throw, rerolling on the madness table on a success. Indefinite madness's you gained from this item cannot be removed in any way while you are attuned to this item.

entries.name: ˙uoısıɔxƎ
entries: You can use this item as a focus for your spells, and you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throws of your spell DCs while attuned to this item.

entries.name: ˙ɯnʇɐɹʇsqnS (Level 6)
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you may regain all your expended sorcery points. When you regain sorcery points in this way, you gain 1 long term madness. This item can't be used in this way again until the next Dusk.

entries.name: ˙ᴎoiƚɒqiꙅꙅiᗡ (Level 11)
entries: At the start of your turn, while you are {@condition Incapacitated}, you may expend 3 sorcery points to immediately end that condition on yourself and gain 1 random indefinite madness and 1 random long term madness.

entries.name: ˙ʎʇıɹǝΛ (Level 15)
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you may inflict madness on one willing creature you are touching. While this madness lasts, the creature has resistance to psychic damage, and shares the benefits of Revelation in Flesh while it's active and they are within 60 ft of you. Only 1 creature can benefit from this feature at a time, and a creature cannot benefit from this feature more than once a week.

entries.name: ˙ɥʇıuǝZ (Level 19)
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your spells instead of a +1. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you may unleash the horrors in a 30 ft {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}. All creatures (Including you) in the emanation must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your sorcerer spell save DC or suffer 1 short term madness. This item can't be used in this way again until the next Dusk.

entries.name: ˙ǝlɓuoɹɥ⊥(Level 23)
entries: You touch 1 creature and attempt to Throngle them. Make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 ft of you. On a hit, the creature is {@condition Slowed|WM4} for 1 minute. A {@condition Slowed|WM4} creature may repeat the save at the end of its turn, ending the condition on itself on a success. If a creature fails the save 3 times, it is Throngled for 1 minute. A Throngled creature has every official condition. After you successfully Throngle a creature, your alignment changes randomly, and you gain 3 indefinite madnesses. This item can't be used in this way again until the next Dusk.

entries.name: Legacy Rituals.
entries: These 2 rituals must be completed to unlock s,ɹǝlɓuoɹɥ⊥ ǝɥ⊥ features.

items: {@b Eldritch Truth.} Expose yourself to the horrors of the far realm, without protection or resistance. This unlocks the level 6-15 features.
{@b Gift of Throngling.} Create a new far realm entity and infuse it into a cadaver. This unlocks the level 19-23 features.

entries: {@note Made by Xin}

item.name: Training Manual: [Talent]
entries: A creature can study the manual in order to learn a new Talent. The amount of time it takes depends on the rarity of the manual. Once a manual is used, it becomes nonmagical. If a creature does not meet the prerequisites for the Talent, it does not gain the Talent and the manual is still consumed.
The Talent the manual gives is chosen by the GM when it is given out. The item is of the same rarity as the Talent.
{@note Made by Gem}

entries.name: Consumable
entries: A reward that is permanently expended upon use.

entries.name: Exotic
entries: A reward that can only be found or received under certain circumstances.

entries.name: Unique
entries: A reward where a very limited number of instances exist.

entries.name: Worn Card
entries: A series of old cards with distinct, intricate art and brown, patterned backs. Although many of them exist, they are almost never found in a complete set, and their old nature causes their powerful magics to only work once before they disintegrate into dust. Rumors mention their magic changing in the rare case of their art being oriented upside down, typically resulting in altered, stronger effects.
{@note You can view all the worn cards on the {@table Worn Cards|WM4|Worn Card Table}}
{@note Based on The Binding of Isaac: Repentance. Made by Miel}
{@i This weapon is barely able to hold itself together, falling apart if the wrong person holds it. Pretty much every weapon in the world is one of these.}
Whenever a creature wielding one of these dies, the weapon immediately breaks apart and turns to dust.
{@note Made by Gem}
{@i A set of armor made out of pure Frostine crystals.}

This armor is cold enough to keep the temperature within 5 feet of it at 32 degrees Fahrenheit (0 degrees Celsius). While wearing this armor you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Cold damage and automatically pass any saves against cold weather.
A creature wearing the armor can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to cast {@spell Rime's Binding Ice|FTD} (DC 14). This property of the armor can't be used again until the next dawn.
{@note Made by Gem}
{@i This weapon is made from Frostine crystals, a cream colored gemstone that is perpetually cold.}
This weapon is cold enough to keep the temperature within 5 feet of it at 32 degrees Fahrenheit (0 degrees Celsius). It deals Cold damage instead of its normal type.
{@note Made by Gem}
{@i A weapon furnished with platinum and gold, giving it a regal presence. It shines brighter in the hands of those with great conviction.}

entries.name: Glory Strike
entries: When you score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} with this weapon, you deal an extra {@dice 1d6} Radiant damage. This extra damage is not doubled by the {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}.
{@note Made by Christoper}
You cannot knock a creature out with this axe. When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with the Undertaker's Axe, you chop off their head, or another equivalent body part, if any.
{@note Made by Gavin}
When you hit with an unreliable weapon, instead of adding an ability modifier to damage rolls, you deal an extra {@dice 1d6} damage of the same type.
{@note Made by Gavin}

When you make an attack with this weapon against a creature and hit, you can verbally command this weapon to "grind" and release it from your grasp. At that time, the weapon animates and continues to grind itself into the foe's flesh. At the start of each of your turns thereafter, it deals damage to the foe as if you had successfully hit with the weapon. The weapon ceases to grind after it has dealt this damage 5 times, where it then falls to the ground.

The foe or another creature with a free hand within reach of it can attempt to rid the foe of the grinding weapon by making a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check (DC 20, uses its object interaction). If a creature succeeds, it is now holding the Weapon of Fleshgrinding and can use it.
{@note From 3.5e Book of Vile Darkness. Adapted by Aris}

This magic weapon deals an additional {@dice 1d4} damage of its type when it is used to attack a beast with a swimming speed. Any beast damaged in this way remains pristine and fully intact for the sake of cooking and consuming.
{@note Made by Patrick}

trait.name: Direction Sense
entries: The Messenger Pigeon has an innate sense of home and can travel long distances to reach a safe place. When the pigeon makes a check to navgate to a place it has been, it rolls this check with Advantage.

trait.name: Pigeon Post Master
entries: When properly trained, the Messenger Pigeon can be taught to travel between pigeon posts and deliver messages.

action.name: Peck
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}{@damage 1} Piercing damage.

hp.special: 20 (Fungus or Vine) or 30 (Tree only) + 5 for each spell level above 2

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the plant spirit remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal plant

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spirit makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (round down).

action.name: Slam (Tree Only)
entries: {@atkr m} {@hitYourSpellAttack Bonus equals your spell attack modifier}, reach 10 ft. {@h}{@damage 1d6 + 4 + summonSpellLevel} Bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Constricting Vine (Vine Only)
entries: {@atkr m} {@hitYourSpellAttack Bonus equals your spell attack modifier}, reach 5 ft. {@h}{@damage 1d4 + 4 + summonSpellLevel} Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the {@condition Grappled} condition (escape DC equals your spell save DC). Until the grapple ends, the target takes 2 ({@dice 1d4}) Bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns, and the vine can't make Constricting Vine attacks.

action.name: Rotting Touch (Fungus Only)
entries: {@atkr m} {@hitYourSpellAttack Bonus equals your spell attack modifier}, reach 5 ft. {@h}{@damage 1d8 + 4 + summonSpellLevel} Necrotic damage.

object.name: Boulder
entries: Each boulder fills a 5ft cube, and is large enough to provide up to Three-Quarters Cover to a standing medium sized creature.
{@note Created by the {@item Tactical Rock Pouch|WM4}}
{@note Made by Gem}

spell.name: Approximate
entries: {@note Adapted from Pathfinder by Landon}

Your magic quickly flows over an area to help you count and catalog. Name a particular type of object you are looking for within the area.
